The forbidding Pillar of Lan Yu plumes white with new smoke, and the warning flames in the village of Talamau burn red and blue with dire promise. Can heroes be found to restore the volcano’s ancient binding, or are the islanders doomed to perish in fire and choking ash?

171123.name: Monopoly: Doctor Who – Regeneration Edition
171123.description:
Tour time, space and beyond.

In this Regeneration Edition of Monopoly, people and places are all up for grabs.

This brand new Regeneration Edition of Doctor Who Monopoly lands on Earth just as the Twelfth Doctor takes to the TARDIS console for the first time. Relive the final days of the Eleventh Doctor, his adventure with the Tenth Doctor and the War Doctor, his quest for the truth about the Impossible Girl and all the excitement of a Regeneration and a new body.

With beautifully crafted special tokens and customised U.N.I.T and TARDIS cards this is the perfect companion piece to the thrills and spills of Season 8.

The aim of the game is to buy and trade properties to collect rent from your fellow players. In this edition the properties are people that the Doctor has met, planets, and locations featured on the show. To win you try to keep your money whilst trying to bankrupt everyone else, as when you are bankrupt you are out of the game.

177752.name: Hero's Journey Home: Gods of Man and More

171124.description:
Hero's Journey Home is a fantasy card and dice game that begins at the end of a great quest. Your adventurers have defeated a terrible enemy and claimed a magical prize, but now they must make the arduous journey back home. Strange and deadly monsters know the adventurers are weak and in possession of a powerful item, and they will pursue them until all have been defeated.

The setup is pretty simple:

1. Choose a quest to have completed; pick up the quest item.
2. Choose your adventurers.
3. If you have a spellcaster (and you should have at least one), choose their spells.
4. Split the Journey deck in two, shuffle both halves and stick the Home card in the bottom half.

Playing is even simpler:

1. Flip Journey cards and resolve the actions.
2. The game ends when either the Home card is drawn or all adventurers have been killed.

The gameplay requires you to manage your resources (adventurers, items, spells, and money) with an eye towards a long-term goal (home) in the face of short-term obstacles (monsters and other unfriendly cards). Every choice you make at every stage of the game will help decide if you make it home.
171124.name: Hero's Journey Home

171125.name: Xit
171125.description:
Xit is a themeless abstract strategy game for two players using some of the principals from the Tixel family of games, including the piece activation mechanics, only reversed.

In Xit, players take turns moving an active (square) piece on a 6x6 (or 8x8) game board. Some of the pieces are missing one or two of their corners. After a piece is moved it is inactivated (by turning it 45 degrees in either direction, or from square to diamond). When a piece is moved past an inactive piece it will push that piece back to its active state it if there is a corner of that piece in its path. Players capture (remove from the board) any pieces of their opponent's activated in this way. Their own pieces remain on the board, ready to be played again.

If a player has no more active pieces, they lose the game.

171126.name: Clue: Supernatural
171126.description: One of the main characters has been possessed by Abaddon and opened a gateway to Hell. It is up to everyone to hunt down who has been possessed, what mystical object was used to open (and can close) the gateway, and where it was opened.

171127.name: Train Simulator 2015
171127.description:
Ever dreamed of driving trains? Now you can! Train Simulator brings to life the thrill of driving high speed trains on real world routes in incredible detail.
Welcome to TS Academy: Your career starts here! Learn to master all kinds of trains, locations and situations as you qualify to be a train driver.
Real World Routes: Ride the rails on New York’s busiest passenger route, take an alpine adventure from Munich and drive the express service to London in a variety of challenging career scenarios.
Build your dream: Turn your hand to building your own routes with a suite of powerful and easy to use creator tools and download more routes and locos from the store.
Master your Machines with Train Simulator 2015.

Source: The Publisher Website.

171128.name: BioShock 2 - Minerva's Den

videogamehonor.31219: 2010 Spike Best DLC of the Year Nominee

171128.description:
User Summary

Minerva's Den puts players in the role of another Alpha Series Big Daddy in a previously unexplored section of Rapture. It features another vision of Rapture within Minerva's Den, a high-technology center of the city, and explores the backstory of the Thinker, a supercomputer responsible for the control of many automatic devices and systems in the underwater utopia, and its creator Charles Milton Porter.

boardgamehonor.28190: 2015 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Children's Game Winner

171129.description:
In Spinderella, players race to get their three ants across the forest floor as quickly as they can, but spiders await in the branches above and — with a little help from opponents — one might swoop down to scoop up your ant and return it to the starting line. You can do the same to them, of course, so search for the right time to act and the right places to hide.

Awards:
- 2015 Winner of Kinderspiel des Jahres
171129.name: Spinderella

171130.name: Siege Warfare
171130.description:
Siege Warfare is a Customizable Strategy Card Game set in the rich history of the American Civil War. Plan your tactics and engage in epic battles with powerful commanders and military units.

Players take turns playing units, ground, tactics, effects, and resources, and may engage opponents in combat or play cards that interact with other cards, players, or decks. Combat is a major part of Siege Warfare and is generally how many games are won or lost. Players must choose their units and attack wisely to ensure victory.

There are many cards in Siege Warfare, and there are no random packs. All Siege Warfare cards are available in one of the 6 ready-to-play decks. Players can purchase any of our 6 ready-to-play decks, or customize their own deck from the cards they own. All decks have 50 cards, and this represents your life total as well as the cards you have at your disposal.

Damage inflicted to an opposing player forces that player to discard that many cards from the top of their deck. The goal of Siege Warfare is to eliminate all of your opponents. A player is eliminated when they have no cards left in their deck.

boardgamehonor.40505: 2016 Golden Geek Best Party Game Nominee

171131.description:
At the bottom of the ocean, no one will hear you scream!

In Captain Sonar, you and your teammates control a state-of-the-art submarine and are trying to locate an enemy submarine in order to blow it out of the water before they can do the same to you. Every role is important, and the confrontation is merciless. Be organized and communicate because a captain is nothing without his crew: the Chief Mate, the Radio Operator, and the Engineer.

All the members of a team sit on one side of the table, and they each take a particular role on the submarine, with the division of labor for these roles being dependent on the number of players in the game: One player might be the captain, who is responsible for moving the submarine and announcing some details of this movement; another player is manning the sonar in order to listen to the opposing captain's orders and try to decipher where that sub might be in the water; a third player might be working in the munitions room to prepare torpedoes, mines and other devices that will allow for combat.

Captain Sonar can be played in two modes: turn-by-turn or simultaneous. In the latter set-up, all the members of a team take their actions simultaneously while trying to track what the opponents are doing, too. When a captain is ready to launch an attack, the action pauses for a moment to see whether a hit has been recorded — then play resumes with the target having snuck away while the attacker paused or with bits of metal now scattered across the ocean floor.

Multiple maps are included with varying levels of difficulty.
171131.name: Captain Sonar

171132.name: Super Win the Game
171132.description:
Super Win the Game is the sequel to You Have to Win the Game, 2012's #1 Free Indie Platformer of the Year (IndieGames.com). It's a bigger, badder, radder, 8-bittier game with a massive world to explore and tons of secrets to find.

Source: The Game Website.

171133.name: Cryptic Explorers
171133.description:
Cryptic Explorers is an asymmetrical, tactical sci-fi horror board game for 2-4 players with two competing sides: the Cryptonauts and the Deities of Death. There are up to three Cryptonaut players and one Deity of Death player. Each Cryptonaut Player has a squad of 2-3 Cryptonauts at their disposal, while the Deity of Death Player chooses one of three different evil death gods to play as.

The Cryptonauts are tasked with entering the dreaded Realm of Death and gathering Knowledge of Death cards by completing objectives and gathering magical artifacts. To aid them, the Cryptonauts have weapons, spells, and various utility cards. The Deity must use Deity Cards to hamper and destroy the Cryptonauts, as well as utilizing summoned monsters. All Deity cards and monsters are unique to each individual Deity.

Cryptic Explorers takes place within the Realms of Death, the outer dimension of pure Death, wherein the Cryptonauts must find their coveted Knowledge of Death and attempt to escape with their lives. Each Realm of Death is a unique, pre-designed game board. Realms of Death have hazards which the Cryptonauts must endure in attempt to complete each Realm's unique objective, and travel to the next Realm, or escape them entirely. If the Cryptonauts collect enough knowledge and survive, they win, whereas if they are killed, the Deity wins.

171134.name: You Have to Win the Game
171134.description:
You Have to Win the Game is an exploration platformer with a retro 1980s PC aesthetic.

Source: The Game Website.

171135.name: Chuck's Challenge 3D
171135.description:
There is a new game in the Chuck's Challenge series called Chuck's Challenge 3D design by Chuck's Sommerville the creator of Chip's Challenge. This new and improved third version is in full 3D on Steam for PC, Mac & Linux and Google Play for lots of Android phones & tablets.

Source: The Game Website.

171136.description:
Your pirate ship has dropped anchor at the terrible island of Pingo Pingo. Legend says that the island is full of treasure, including the famous Golden Pineapple, but it also says that treasure is fiercely guarded by hordes of fearsome penguin warriors, some of which ride giant polar bears. That potential danger is why you're alone in your boat, on your own but eager to take a run on the island and try your luck.

For now, only the sound of the waves and the cries of the gulls disturb the peace of this seemingly idyllic island...but as soon as you set foot in the jungle bordering the beach, the drums of war start sounding and you realize that you've suddenly gained the status of prey!

Pingo Pingo is a hyper-frenetic action game punctuated by a soundtrack in which you have to react quickly, run, shoot a gun, in which you must be precise, brave, fast, and focused because if not, well, you might not leave the island in one piece. As soon as the soundtrack begins, the game is on!

On your turn, reveal the top card from your deck and place it face-up in the middle of the table. Each card requires a specific action when it is revealed. Be the first to tap on a treasure to grab it, but watch out for traps and critters, and make sure the music allows you to take this treasure. Tap on camp cards to steal cards from the other players' stashes. Adventure cards trigger actions to be completed before the "Pingo Pingo" cry in the soundtrack. Get up and run from one base to another to cross a suspension bridge. Grab the gun and aim well to defeat fearsome bear riders. Tap the friendly monkey sorcerer to regain life. Run to the shipwreck and back to shoot the gigantic space penguin. Grab all the previously played cards and deal them as fast as you can to escape the penguin rampage!

Any mistake will cost you one of your seven life points. After 15 minutes, the player with the most treasures wins the game — but don't be reckless because you can't carry more than three treasures per life point...
171136.name: Pingo Pingo

171137.name: Island Light
171137.description:
User Summary

Island Light was a survival horror game with zombies. The game was notoriously buggy and attracted alot of negative publicity. The game was available for purchase for a short while before its negative publicity and public backlash saw it permanently made unavailable.

171138.name: Only iF
171138.description:
User Summary

Only iF has you play as Anthony Clyde. After a night of partying he wakes up in an unfamiliar bed with no memory of the previous night's events.

171139.name: Minecraft: Story Mode - Season 1, Episode 1: The Order of the Stone

videogameseries.28720: Minecraft: Story Mode – A TellTale Game Series

videogamehonor.34989: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Childrens Game of the Year Winner

videogamecompilation.210439: Minecraft: Story Mode – The Complete Adventure

171139.description:
User Summary

Minecraft: Story Mode - Episode: 1 is a narrative-driven game series set in the world of Minecraft. It is not an add-on for Minecraft, but a stand-alone product and will feature a story driven by player choice. It will not delve into the origin of Steve but will explore more about the world.

171140.name: Wildlife Park
171140.description:
User Summary

Wildlife Park has you build and manage a zoo. Animals will need to be fed, trained, cured when ill, and occasionally relocated.

171141.name: Wildlife Park 2 - Dino World
171141.description:
User Summary

Wildlife Park 2 - Dino World expands the game by adding in 11 different dinosaurs over the course of 9 new missions.

171142.name: Wildlife Park 2 - Farm World
171142.description:
User Summary

Wildlife Park 2 - Farm World expands the game by adding in 10 different animals over the course of 7 new missions and 20 freeplaymaps.

171143.name: Quantum tic-tac-toe
171143.description:
Quantum tic-tac-toe is a "quantum generalization" of tic-tac-toe in which the players' moves are "superpositions" of plays in the classical game. The game was invented by Allan Goff of Novatia Labs.

Quantum tic-tac-toe captures the three quantum phenomena discussed above by modifying one basic rule of classical tic-tac-toe: the number of marks allowed in each square. Additional rules specify when and how a set of marks "collapses" into classical moves.

On each move, the current player marks two squares with their letter (X or O), instead of one, and each letter (X or O) is subscripted with the number of the move (beginning counting with 1). The pair of marks are called spooky marks. (Because X always moves first, the subscripts on X are always odd and the subscripts on O are always even.)

For example, player 1's first move might be to place "X1" in both the upper left and lower right squares. The two squares thus marked are called entangled. During the game, there may be as many as eight spooky marks in a single square (if the square is entangled with all eight other squares).

The phenomenon of collapse is captured by specifying that a "cyclic entanglement" causes a "measurement". A cyclic entanglement is a cycle in the entanglement graph; for example, if

square 1 is entangled via move X1 with square 4, and
square 4 is entangled via move X3 with square 8, and
square 8 is in turn entangled via move O4 with square 1,
then these three squares form a cyclic entanglement. At the end of the turn on which the cyclic entanglement was created, the player whose turn it is not — that is, the player who did not create the cycle — chooses one of two ways to "measure" the cycle and thus cause all the entangled squares to "collapse" into classical tic-tac-toe moves. In the preceding example, since player 2 created the cycle, player 1 decides how to "measure" it. Player 1's two options are:

X1 collapses into square 1. This forces O4 to collapse into square 8 and X3 to collapse into square 4.
X1 collapses into square 4. This forces X3 to collapse into square 8 and O4 to collapse into square 1.
Any other chains of entanglements hanging off the cycle would also collapse at this time; for example, if square 1 were also entangled via O2 with square 5, then either measurement above would force O2 to collapse into square 5. (Note that it is impossible for two or more cyclic entanglements to be created in a single turn.)

When a move collapses into a single square, that square is permanently marked (in larger print) with the letter and subscript of the collapsed move — a classical mark. A square containing a classical mark is fixed for the rest of the game; no more spooky marks may be placed in it.

The first player to achieve a tic-tac-toe (three in a row horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) consisting entirely of classical marks is declared the winner. Since it is possible for a single measurement to collapse the entire board and give classical tic-tac-toes to both players simultaneously, the rules declare that the player whose tic-tac-toe has the lower maximum subscript earns one point, and the player whose tic-tac-toe has the higher maximum subscript earns only one-half point.

171145.name: Murder Miners
171145.description:
User Summary

Murder Miners is a typical survival shooter game with zombies. It features minecraft-like destructable environments.

171146.name: Pineview Drive
171146.description:
User Summary

You play a man named who visits an abandoned mansion at the dead end of Pineview Drive hoping to solve the disappearance of his wife Linda from 20 years earlier.

171147.name: Yakkaz
171147.description:
Yakkaz is not available to purchase, being the third in a series of specially commissioned welcome gifts for visitors to Le Grand Massif ski resort in Haute-Savoie, France. The previous games in the series were ZOU in 2012 (an adaptation of Mow) and Kizz-Kizz in 2013 (an adaptation of Niya).

Yakkaz is similar to Yahtzee, but instead of regular dice, five sides have images of the Tootizz, guardians of Le Grand Massif (see the Tootizz story). The sixth side has an image of Zhinzho the dragon.

On a turn, players roll the dice up to three times and mark one (or optionally two) results on a score sheet. If more than one Zhinzho is rolled, they can be used to improve an already marked score; each line can be improved only once. The highest score at the end of the game wins.

171149.name: The Day Before Apocalypse (HARP)
171149.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure that spans ten thousand years.

This is the way the world ends.

The party has failed. After the events of The Last Hallowed Place, the characters must seek out one of the greatest Holy Relics, but in doing so they must survive the armies of the Demon Queen.

An adventure for 18th level characters.

171150.name: The Day Before Apocalypse (Rolemaster)
171150.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure that spans ten thousand years.

This is the way the world ends.

The party has failed. After the events of The Last Hallowed Place, the characters must seek out one of the greatest Holy Relics, but in doing so they must survive the armies of the Demon Queen.

An adventure for 18th level characters.

171151.name: Vathak Grimoires: The Drowning Ceremony
171151.description:
From publisher blurb:

Early one chill morning, a fisherman discovered a collection of unusually large scales, dried fins, and flattened pieces of reed strung together with moldy netting washed up on the shore of Lake Pethegas. He believed it to be nothing but flotsam, but as he approached, he noticed faint markings of an unknown language scribbled upon its pieces. The words seemed to twist and writhe of their own accord, and the fisherman ran screaming from the lakeside. To this day, he grows pale at the sight of any large body of water.

Vathak Grimoires: The Drowning Ceremony is a supplement for Shadows over Vathak, especially those exploring the area of the Colonies. This product is a perfect supplement for any Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, especially horror. The Vathak Grimoires product line presents a single spellbook with history, spells, rituals, and other new and optional rules.

171152.name: Curse of Lannil Island
171152.description:
From publisher blurb:

The island of Gavea is a mist-covered island off the western coast of Exodus. A map to a long lost treasure as your guide, you will have to survive strange alliances, fields of sugarcane, and the curse of Lannil Island.

An adventure written for APL 5 (characters level 4 through 6).

171153.name: The Corridor
171153.description:
User Summary

The Corridor is a freeware Russian indie horror game.

The game is available to download now, but is still in developlment.

171154.name: The Day Before Apocalypse (D20 3.5)
171154.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure that spans ten thousand years.

This is the way the world ends.

The party has failed. After the events of The Last Hallowed Place, the characters must seek out one of the greatest Holy Relics, but in doing so they must survive the armies of the Demon Queen.

An adventure for 12th level characters.

171155.name: In His Name / The Last Hallowed Place (D20 3.5)
171155.description:
From publisher blurb:

In His Name
Pages: 170

At His word, the world does tremble.

Veteran game designer Robert J Defendi brings you a world of darkness and danger, where a monolithic church has split into dozens of quarreling factions and holy war looms like a shadow. Here, strength and brutality win the day and only those with the most faith, honor, and courage can stand against the terrible tyranny of those who would enslave everyone of a different belief, a different philosophy, a different race.

Worse, it is a world infected by the very fabric of Hell itself.

In the Mortal Realm, God's word might arrive distant and thin, but it comes amplified through the throats of countless priests. It is written in the books of a legion of druids. It pounds in the conquering hooves of armies, and shines in the swords of zealots.

The word of God is still heard, and the world still trembles.


The Last Hallowed Place (Part 5 in The Moving Shadow)
Pages: 46

An adventure that spans ten thousand years.

This is the way the world ends.

The party has failed. Morthorn trapped them in an Ulcer and while they escaped, now his trail has long gone cold. Can our heroes find and stop the fallen angel before he brings about his plan and starts the end of the world?

An adventure for 15th level characters.

Requires the world's most popular roleplaying game to play.

171158.name: The Throne of God (HARP)
171158.description:
From publisher blurb:

And God wept.

It was the last days of the War in Heaven. One thousand years had passed wince a third of the host fell, and in that time, your families stood on the parapets of Heaven, fighting beside Angel and Mortal alike. It was a long and painful war, and on this day, it ended.

But the fallen Angels didn't fight alone. Slowly the mortals of Heaven - Humans, elves, Gnomes, Halflings... even the Dwarves - defected to the other side. Worse yet, somehow the Fallen Host commanded not only the living, but the dead... creatures who walked about in direct defiance of God's laws.

But the battle went poorly for the Fallen Host and on this day they made a last, desperate attempt to take the Holy city of Heaven, the location of the Holy See, the seat of God's Throne. After this battle, Heaven would stand or fall...

Welcome to the first adventure in the Moving Shadow campaign. This adventure, The Throne of God, is the first of a ten part series that will take a group of character through the Mortal Realm.

171161.name: The Festering Earth (D20 3.5)
171161.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was the last days of the War in Heaven.

It was six months before the Sundering, six months before the Second Falling, before the last, desperate battle. Six months before everything you cared about turned to ashes. You had been called from across Heaven, volunteers who had journeyed out to the edge of the lands of the Faithful. You'd all traveled hard and far to meet with one of the great generals of the war, the Archangel Areniel. The light of God shone everywhere in Heaven those days, except in Hell, the lands of the Fallen. The border knew the only true twilight in Heaven.

Here the light of God shines dim. Here the Faithful stand against the heretics. Here you meed on the road to the border fortress Stands in Faith...

Welcome to the second adventure in the Moving Shadow campaign. This adventure, The Festering Earth, is the second of a ten-part series that will take a group of characters through the Mortal Realm.

171164.name: On Corrupted Ground (Rolemaster)
171164.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was the last days of the War in Heaven.

You have left the lands of the Faithful behind. This was the time before the sun and the moon, the time before night and day. Only the Holy See, in the destance, shone light for the world. A constant light, gentle and even, no matter how far one traveled from the Holy City.

Except for here.

But you have a mission, given by the Archangel Areniel. You are to penetrate as deeply as possible, to find the home of the Fallen Angel Mathos.

Here are the lands of the Fallen, the lands of the damned Angels and the heretic Mortals who follow them. Here the light never shines and the oppression is unrelenting.

Here, you will likely die.

Welcome to the third adventure in the Moving Shadow campaign. This adventure, On Corrupted Ground, is the third of a ten part series that will take a group of characters through the Mortal Realm.

171167.name: The Tainted Tears (D20 3.5)
171167.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was the last days of Heaven.

All of Heaven used to shine with the light of God, but as you poshed deeper and deeper into the Fallen Lands, all you saw was darkness and horror and rot. The Light of God did not enter these lands. It wasn't that it couldn't, but the God Himself had denied his most treacherous children the light. In the lack of light, the crops withered and faded, and the topsoil eroded. Winds whipped stinging sand across most of the land, all except those few fields where the Fallen Angels created enough light for plants to struggle into something resembling life. A treacherous, half existence.

There you walk, mile after mile of desolation around you. Few mortals live this far into the Fallen Lands. this is a place of the foul betrayers of God, the Fallen Angels. Around you, endless stretches of bitterness, hate and fury. The fate of those who'd risen against their Fallen.

Welcome to the fourth adventure in the Moving Shadow campaign. This adventure, On Corrupted Ground, is the third of a ten part series that will take a group of characters through the Mortal Realm.

171170.name: Green Lantern: Make a Match
171170.description:
Hal Jordan, Sinestro, Abin Sur and other characters in the the Green Lantern world are hiding. On your turn, pick any two cards. If they match, you get to keep them.

Find a pair of the special Green Lantern ring cards and you get to take the ring. There are several of those in the game, so it moves from player to player. Be the one who has it at the end of the game and you'll get bonus points. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

171171.name: The Echoes of Heaven Campaign Setting / The Throne of God (Rolemaster)
171171.description:
From publisher blurb:

Areniel leaped off the parapets of Heaven. The stone battlements of the city fell away beneath him even as rolling lands stretched out on all sides. On his flanks the rest of the Host rose in unison - the hand of God, propelled by His will. As Areniel flew into the air, the lush fields of Heaven fell into the distance, a yellow-flecked expanse of grass stirring in the wind of a thousand angelic wings. The FallenHost flew above them, vicious weapons glittering in the in the light, their armor blackened in the absence of God's glory. Soon they'd glisten with blood...

The Echoes of Heaen is a game world of darkness and danger, where a monolithic church has split into dozens of quarreling factions and holy war looms like a shadow. Here, strength and brutality win the day and only those with the most faith, honor and courage can stand against the terrible tyranny of those who would enslave everyone of a different belief, a different philosophy, a different race.

Worse, it is a world infected by the very fabric of Hell itself.

Inside you will find The Echoes of Heaven Campaign Setting and The Throne of God, part one of a ten-part epic campaign The Moving Shadow.

171174.name: The Echoes of Heaven Bestiary (HERO)
171174.description:
From publisher blurb:

Korum stumbled clear of the blast of air, his ears ringing, the skin onhis face raw from the merciless slap of wind. For a moment, he stood disoriented, then the training kicked in. Whatever else his enemy was, he was a witch.

The mountain pass crumbled and wound down the incline bhind him even as the dying light painted the walls of the cleft red and orange, gleamed off the blac armor of his enemy. The man stood, helmetless before Korum, sword held easily in one hand, the other still raised from his last magical blast.

No. Korum had to get out of here.

Foul and tainted creatures stalk this way.

Towering Nephilim. Wiked Cambions, Nobel Angels and fallen Devils. The legions of Hell. The dreaded Elemental Wraiths. Since the release of The Echoes of Heaven, our products have been filled with hints and descriptions of these creatures. Some of them are familiar. Some of them are wholly new. Look no further, because here you will find the creatures unique to The Echoes of Heaven.

171177.name: Jewels of Tara
171177.description: Jewels of Tara follows the tale of Princess Tara & her lost jewelry. The Jewels of Tara are lost in a spiral take on a Snakes and Ladders board. You must find the jewels, which are represented by cards. Take jewels you find to her trusted jewelers in the "labyrinth", who can certify their authenticity. They will also fashion the jewels you find into articles of jewelry. Bring the best jewelry to Princess Tara first to win!

As Areniel flew into the air, the lush fields of Heaven fell into the distance, a yellow-flecked expanse of grass stirring in the wind of a thousand angelic wings. The Fallen Host flew above them, vicious weapons glittering in the in the light, their armor blackened in the absence of God's glory. Soon they'd glisten with blood...

The Echoes of Heaven is a game world of darkness and danger, where a monolithic church has split into dozens of quarreling factions and holy war looms like a shadow. Here, strength and brutality win the day and only those with the most faith, honor and courage can stand against the terrible tyranny of those who would enslave everyone of a different belief, a different philosophy, a different race.

Worse, it is a world infected by the very fabric of Hell itself.

171180.name: The Echoes of Heaven Campaign Setting (D20 3.5)
171180.description:
From publisher blurb:

Areniel leaped off the parapets of Heaven. The stone battlements of the city fell away beneath him even as rolling lands stretched out on all sides. On his flanks the rest of the Host rose in unison - the hand of God, propelled by His will. As Areniel flew into the air, the lush fields of Heaven fell into the distance, a yellow-flecked expanse of grass stirring in the wind of a thousand angelic wings. The Fallen Host flew above them, vicious weapons glittering in the in the light, their armor blackened in the absence of God's glory. Soon they'd glisten with blood...

The Echoes of Heaven is a game world of darkness and danger, where a monolithic church has split into dozens of quarreling factions and holy war looms like a shadow. Here, strength and brutality win the day and only those with the most faith, honor and courage can stand against the terrible tyranny of those who would enslave everyone of a different belief, a different philosophy, a different race.

Worse, it is a world infected by the very fabric of Hell itself.

171182.name: The Lost Kingdom of the Dwarves (D20 3.5)
171182.description:
From publisher blurb:

Undîm stood at the edge of the parapet, squinting off to the south. The wind fluttered his cloak, whistling above his armor and through his mail, stirring his beard. The sky arced blue and inifinite above him, making him feel alone and exposed, despite the surrounding troops. "Any word?" he asked.

Shand shook his grizzled head. "No, sir. Nothing since the refugees arrived at Athal."

Undîm growled and looked down the southern pass. "He's coming, I can feel it."

Shand squinted off tot he south as well. "Why wouldn't he take the underground road?"

"There's no room to maneuver. Better to expose yourself to ambushes from the surrounding peaks."

Whatever Shand was going to say next was lost when one of theguards shouted and pointed south. Undîm squinted harder and could just make out a cloud of dust creeping over a spur of peaks.

That's him," Undîm said.

Urzarâg. The name brings up images of despair, broken dreams and lost glory. It's the seed of evil, the home of a Warlord. It's a breeding ground for Orcs and the rallying point of armies. From here the Ords flow, waging war against the Mortals of the world.

This was once the greatest Dwarven kingdom in Balkanâth.

But glory is fleeting.

171183.name: Legendarium Inferni
171183.description:
user summary

Adventures book for Aquelarre RPG.

In spanish:
Legendarium Inferni es un suplemento de aventuras para Aquelarre. En sus páginas se presentan tres completos módulos repletos de historia, brujas y demonios que contienen todo el espíritu de Aquelarre.

171184.name: The Lost Kingdom of the Dwarves (HERO)
171184.description:
From publisher blurb:

Undîm stood at the edge of the parapet, squinting off to the south. The wind fluttered his cloak, whistling above his armor and through his mail, stirring his beard. The sky arced blue and inifinite above him, making him feel alone and exposed, despite the surrounding troops. "Any word?" he asked.

That's him," Undîm said.

Urzarâg. The name brings up images of despair, broken dreams and lost glory. It's the seed of evil, the home of a Warlord. It's a breeding ground for Orcs and the rallying point of armies. From here the Ords flow, waging war against the Mortals of the world.

This was once the greatest Dwarven kingdom in Balkanâth.

But glory is fleeting.

171185.name: The Lost Kingdom of the Dwarves (Rolemaster)
171185.description:
From publisher blurb:

Undîm stood at the edge of the parapet, squinting off to the south. The wind fluttered his cloak, whistling above his armor and through his mail, stirring his beard. The sky arced blue and inifinite above him, making him feel alone and exposed, despite the surrounding troops. "Any word?" he asked.

Undîm growled and looked down the southern pass. "He's coming, I can feel it."

Shand squinted off tot he south as well. "Why wouldn't he take the underground road?"

"There's no room to maneuver. Better to expose yourself to ambushes from the surrounding peaks."

Whatever Shand was going to say next was lost when one of theguards shouted and pointed south. Undîm squinted harder and could just make out a cloud of dust creeping over a spur of peaks.

That's him," Undîm said.

Urzarâg. The name brings up images of despair, broken dreams and lost glory. It's the seed of evil, the home of a Warlord. It's a breeding ground for Orcs and the rallying point of armies. From here the Ords flow, waging war against the Mortals of the world.

This was once the greatest Dwarven kingdom in Balkanâth.

But glory is fleeting.

171186.name: The Last Free City (Rolemaster)
171186.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was the humidity that made the duty miserable. Conus Caedelus stood on the docks of Kerius. Flies swarmed over his armor and crawled under his clothing. He whipped and beat at them in the sweltering heat, but the buckets of sweat just enticed new flies. The summer heat would only worse as the day progressed. The sea breeze was cooler,but it was heavy with water and even with it, he felt as if he were boiling alive.

When he turned and continued his patrol, he caught a hint of white out to sea. Squinting, he could just make out a sail. No, three sails. No, five. More. Many more. He turned and hollered for his centurion. Gaius Magnus, his red plume proud and high in the air strode over to Conus. "What is it soldier?"

"Ships, sir."

Gaius looked out to see and nodded as he noted the sails as well. "It's about damn time. Let someone else shoot Elves for a living. Maybe this means we'll get a little leave..."

Sheltered in the lands of Ingrast but beyond the woods of the Elves, this city has remarkable freedom... but with freedom comes danger. Felric's Redoubt is a land of merchants and craftsmen,a cosmopolitan city that acts as a center of trade for all the world. This makes it a hub of culture and learning. Many would say taht it's the axle of the world.

But the axle turns.

171187.name: The Last Free City (HERO)
171187.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was the humidity that made the duty miserable. Conus Caedelus stood on the docks of Kerius. Flies swarmed over his armor and crawled under his clothing. He whipped and beat at them in the sweltering heat, but the buckets of sweat just enticed new flies. The summer heat would only worse as the day progressed. The sea breeze was cooler,but it was heavy with water and even with it, he felt as if he were boiling alive.

Many would say taht it's the axle of the world.

But the axle turns.

171188.name: The Last Free City (D20 3.5)
171188.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many would say taht it's the axle of the world.

But the axle turns.

171189.name: Junkyard
171189.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 30 inch Battlemap of a Junkyard, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“You wanna pay for parts with money? We can get money. But we could use a few favors if you wanna get your hands dirty. Whatdya say?”

DramaScape throws it all into the junkyard even the fridge!

Junkyard is an exterior and interior map of a small scrapyard with an office and warehouse.

Junkyard is intended for use in modern, horror, near-future science fiction, or post-apocalyptic games.

Adventure hook for this map:

A Scrap for some Scrap: In a post-apocalyptic future, last session the group’s vehicle was severely damaged and needs repaired. After a long search for parts, the group hears about a mostly intact scrapyard with parts for buses, cars, bikes, and even helicopters. The only problem is that a crooked bunch of local gangers controls the scrapyard.

The group needs to either negotiate or fight the gangers to get the parts they need to restore their vehicle. Negotiating with the gangers might even lead to them doing some shady missions for the gangers to get the parts like extortion, gathering protection money from the local village. Fighting the gangers is actually tougher than usual as the gangers have access to a large weapon cache of pre-apocalypse weapons in the junkyard warehouse.

171190.name: (Unusual) Magic Rings and 1d100 of them
171190.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alphabet Soup is a comprehensive guide to words commonly (and uncommonly) found in games or used by gamers. It provides quick, easy definitions in lexicon form: gaming terms, definitions, historical context, mythological terms. It even gives gamemasters advice on how they can use them in their games. It works like an encyclopedia of random bits, only these random bits are things I think are interesting for gamemasters.

In this particular edition, I've provided a 1d100 chart of magic rings (and their side effects) that will flesh out any fantasy game.

171191.description:
The Starting Player Route Card for Blocky Mountains was first released as a PDF available for download from the publisher's website. This card is intended to be used as a more fun, thematic, and prowess-showing way of determining the start player.

Setup
The illustration on the card depicts blocks with and without numbers. The non-numbered blocks are the basic setup, but by adding the numbered gray blocks, you can increase the difficulty to level 2 or 3 (this is clearly depicted on the back of the card).

Play

First, all players simultaneously bid by showing fingers from their fist equal to the skill level each thinks she can complete. Then, the player who has shown the highest level (e.g., three fingers = difficulty level 3), has one attempt at the appropriate route.
If the player masters the route, she takes the white route marker and becomes the starting player on the route map. If she fails, she takes the last position in turn order, followed by the player with the next lower difficulty level, etc.




Very important: If several players have shown the same number of fingers, then whichever of them is first to shout, “Trapper,” is the one who must face the challenge. If there's still a tie, then whoever shouts “Grizzly” first takes the challenge!
171191.name: Blocky Mountains: Starting Player Route Card

171192.name: Coat Of Arms: Heraldry of the Noble Knight
171192.description:
From the Publisher:

50+ single page files of Coats of Arms I have collected over the years and comes with a 7 page index featuring all of the Coats of Arms. Some are historical and a few whimsical.

171193.name: The Trail of Stone and Sorrow

rpgitemversion.262879: The Trail of Stone and Sorrow  PDF Version

171193.description:
From the publisher:

The Trail of Stone and Sorrow is a small mini-adventure taking place in a sleepy alpine village. Something wicked has emerged from the mountains and begun turning things to stone. The villagers are scared and have begun casting a suspicious eye towards a foreign wizard. This adventure is statted for both Neoclassical Geek Revival as well as your favourite retroclone or other Old School adventure game. It is meant for levels 1 to 3.

171194.description:
A pre-release promo from the Tokyo game market.

It adds a female samurai warrior to the game, who will move before the players do. Whoever supports her the most will receive her help.
171194.name: Minotaur Max!: Onna no Bushi

171195.name: Disney Princess:  Palace Pets Royal Pet Salon
171195.description: Get regally pampered in the dreamy, 3D Royal Pet Salon. Move your adorable pet from room to room through doorways sized just for castle cuties. Look for posh pet products, from fancy soaps and shampoos to tiaras, collars, and sweet treats—all hidden throughout the salon! If you find something pictured on a face-up card, it’s yours to keep! When the time is up, all of the Palace Pets leave the salon with the grooming goodies. The player with the most wins!

171197.description:
Localized version of TransAmerica, settled in the city of Bielefeld, Germany.

Players work together building a tram railway network, but this time it is across Bielefeld instead of the United States. The first to have their five stations connected wins the round - the others lose points for being too slow! After 3-4 rounds, the player with the most points wins the game!

According to the description on the box, Trans Bielefeld+includes Vexation, but it doesn´t.
171197.name: Trans Bielefeld: Eine Spur schneller

171198.name: The Shab al-Hiri Roach at Hogwarts
171198.description:
From publisher blurb:

An ever-so-slightly hacked re-skin of The Shab al-Hiri Roach by Jason Morningstar. This hack transplants the madcap hijinx of the Roach into the magical world of Hogwarts. Ideal for one-shots and convention games, requires The Shab al-Hiri Roach to play.

171199.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Raid the world of myth and legend! Crush every foe you meet. Backstab your friends and steal their stuff. Grab the treasure and run.

Munchkin Legends Deluxe is the Munchkin card game about legendary adventure...with none of that stupid roleplaying stuff. You'll defeat mythic monsters and grab fabled magic items! Don the Death Mask and Achilles' Heels. Wield Thor's Hammer...or maybe the Magic Bassoon. Start by slaughtering the Heebie-Jeebies and Johnny Zucchiniseed, and work your way up to the Kraken...

Munchkin Legends Deluxe includes a game board and character pawns in addition to the components of the Munchkin Legends base game. The original printing also came with Munchkin Legends 2: Faun and Games, a 56-card expansion that introduces a new race — the Faun — as well as more jokes and puns based on figures from mythology and history. With Faun and Games you can use the "Spear of Destiny" to fight "J.R.R. Trollkin" or fend off the "Wendigo" with your "Hell Toupee".
171199.name: Munchkin Legends Deluxe

171200.name: Basic Gaming Resource: 10,000 Names
171200.description:
User Summary:

A small collection of Excel spreadsheets that contain over 10,000 names for use with any game system, setting, etc.

171201.name: Blank Map Pack Vol 1
171201.description:
User Summary:

A collection of 40 generic maps. The maps depict dungeons, caves and towns. These are usable with any system or setting.

171202.name: Foozle
171202.description: Foozle is a progressive bid game for three to eight players, in which players attempt to take exactly as many tricks as they bid or be penalized. Unlike many bidding games, Foozle is not a partners game, but an individual "cut-throat" type of card game.

171203.name: Investigator Weapons, Volume 2: Modern Day
171203.description:
From publisher blurb:

“I shot my answering machine today. Took out the old twelve gauge my father left me, and blew it to pieces. A silly, futile gesture, I know, but it illustrates my present state of mind, I think.” – Paul F. Wilson, ‘The Barrens’ (1989)

Investigator Weapons for Call of Cthulhu in the Modern Era is a comprehensive collection of weapons available to stalwart investigators of the Cthulhu Mythos and their crazed cultist opponents.

Investigator Weapons 2 covers handguns, rifles and assault rifles, shotguns, submachine guns and personal defence weapons, machine guns, grenade launchers, rocket launchers, melee weapons, explosives, and special ammunition; and gathers together all the spot rules for injury, environmental conditions, and firearms combat in one place, as well as introducing many optional rules for enhanced play.

Hans-Christian Vortisch (author of Investigator Weapons 1, GURPS Covert Ops, GURPS High-Tech, and GURPS Tactical Shooting) has selected many dozens of the most typical or iconic weapons available to the discerning shooter today. These range from the famous Glock 17 pistol, H&K MP5 submachine gun, and Kalashnikov assault rifle to many lesser known, but even more widespread firearms – as well as specialized designs developed for assassins, combat divers, and special forces.

Each weapon is illustrated and described in detail, as are numerous variant models, each with its own statistics bar. Significantly, each weapon's operation is described, allowing the Keeper and his players to convincingly portray its use and effect. Accompanying every weapon description is a comprehensive list of the movies where it appears – so that you can see and hear it in action!

Nor is the Keeper forgotten! Typical weapons for non-player characters are suggested, as are likely weapons for cultists from around the world. A Keeper’s chapter examines the consequences of magic on firearms and ammunition, and the effect of firearms on Mythos creatures.

Investigator Weapons 2 – The essential modern weapons book for Keeper and players of all editions of Call of Cthulhu and other RPGs of Lovecraftian investigative horror in the modern age.

171204.name: The Tome of Terrors & Treaures
171204.description:
designer summary

The Tome of Terrors & Treasures contains more than 300 animals and monsters as well as new treasures and treasure charts to add to your Heroes & Other Worlds game.

Ownership of Heroes & Other Worlds core rules and the
Magi Carta are necessary to fully utilize this books

171205.name: Jack and Jill
171205.description: Try to move Jack or Jill to the top of the hill without getting knocked to bottom by marbles rolling down the hill. Marbles released from a plastic well at the top of the hill.

171207.name: The Code Breakers World
171207.description:
User Summary:

A standalone setting chapter for the D6xD6 RPG, based on a post-apocalyptic science-fiction novel involving conspiracies and a deadly artificial intelligence.

This PDF was issued to backers of the Kickstarter project, and forms part of the larger publication that includes all setting chapters reached as part of the project's stretch goals.

From the Introduction:

Humans, transhumans, and artificial intelligences battle for survival and supremacy in the post-Apocalyptic future of the Code Breakers novels.

171208.name: Smash Hit

videogamehonor.32150: 2015 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee

171208.description:
User Summary

Smash Hit is an reflex action game in which you fire metal balls at glass obstacles to clear the path and get to the end of each level. Crystals increase your ball count and special powerups give you abilities to make it easier to keep your way clear and get you to the end of all 12 levels.

The free version offers a standard mode of play, while the paid version adds several more modes and continuation at checkpoints in the standard mode.

171209.name: Garbage Pail Kids: Disgusting Dice Game
171209.description: Garbage Pail Kids: Disgusting Dice Game uses classic Garbage Pail Kids art, includes custom dice, and is due out in 2015 to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the Garbage Pail Kids trading cards.

171210.name: BEDLAM
171210.description:
User Summary

BEDLAM has you play as Heather Quinn (aka Athena) who is trapped in the world of video games and must try to escape.

171211.name: Muertoons
171211.description:
In Muertoons, based on the animated series Muertoons and the 2003 card game Spooks, you get to follow the Muertoons characters to the Dia de los Muertos celebration — but only if you can get past grumpy Tio Rico, who hates the noise and lights of Dia de los Muertos and is making things difficult.

The Muertoons can show you the way to the event, but you need to do your part, too, by playing your numbered cards in the right order and discarding everything in your hand.; the first person to discard all their cards leads their friends to the Dia de los Muertos celebration!

171212.name: The Fifth Day
171212.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

The Fifth Day is set after mankind's extinction at the hands of machines. You play one of the machines and must survive in the hostile world left behind by man.

171213.name: Pokémon Vietnamese Crystal
171213.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Gold and Silver.




User Summary

Pokémon Vietnamese Crystal is a bootlegged version of Pokémon Crystal and was first discovered in Vietnam, although it was most likely made in China or Taiwan. It went through a poor translation from Japanese to English (via Chinese translators) which has led to nonsensical and unintentionally humorous Engrish dialogue. Pokemon are called elves in this game.

171214.name: Pokémon Diamond and Jade
171214.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Keitai Denjū Telefang.




User Summary

Pokémon Diamond and Jade is a counterfeit of the game Keitai Denjū Telefang which was unofficially translated from Japanese to English. The Power Version was used to make Diamond, and the Speed Version became Jade. The name Pokemon Jade has also been used for another pirated game that used Sonic Adventures 7. Some cartridges contain both Diamond and Jade in one or come bundled with a pirated poorly translated Pokémon Crystal.

The creature on the box art of Pokémon Jade is not from either the Pokémon series or Keitai Denjū Telefang but is instead the forest spirit from Hayao Miyazaki's film Princess Mononoke. Many of the knock-off cartridges also contain serious programming errors which cause the game to crash.

171215.name: Afterfall: Reconquest – Episode 1
171215.description:
User Summary

Afterfall: Reconquest is set in a post-apocalyptic world slowly rising from the ruins of the old civilization. The game has nine episodes each focusing on different overlapping scenarios.

171216.name: Automobile: Chicken – 2 Player Variant

boardgamecompilation.151122: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #6

171216.description:
2 Player Variant for Martin Wallace's Automobile. Includes 6 tiles and a rule sheet. Released with Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #6

Starting The Game


Each player receives 6 RD cubes.
Place character tiles into an opaque bag or container and mix them. *Draw 2 character tiles and place these tiles on their character tiles in the character boxes. These characters are out of play for the first round.
Next, draw 2 more character tiles, placing them on the empty space in the turn track box. These characters will be out of play the following round.
Set aside the salesman pieces of 1 color; these will be neutral.
Place 1 advertisement marker (white) on each of the first 2 spaces.
Place 2 discount markers (gray) on the first gray space and 1 on the second space.
The third spaces will not be used in this variant (you can cover these with a factory from an unused color.)
Remove 2 “5” value and 1 “4” value demand tiles from the game.


P2: Select Characters


You may not select characters that have a character tile currently on them.


P3: Player Actions

II: Place Salesman


When you place your salesman you must place 1 neutral salesman, in addition to your allowed pieces, in 1 of the same showrooms that you occupied with this action.


P5: Sell Cars Via Salesman


When it comes to your turn and you have decided to sell a car or pass, you must move one of the neutral pieces to 1 of the sales tracks to the left. Before being moved to the sales track a neutral salesman can be moved up or down a maximum of 1 segment.


P9: End of Turn


Remove the character tiles from the character boxes and return them into the opaque bag or container. Move the 2 character tiles in the turn track box onto the appropriate character boxes; these characters are now out of play for this round. Draw 2 new character tiles, and place these on the empty space in the turn track box.
Each player places 1 closed factory marker onto the first open space beyond their farthest factory built.

171217.description:
A promotional card given out during the 2014 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

This promo introduces a new Crossroads Card that you can use in the game.
171217.name: Dead of Winter: Lucky Luke Smith

150376.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game

171218.name: Pokémon Chaos Black
171218.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Red and Blue.




User Summary

Pokémon Chaos Black is a pirated version of Pokemon Fire Red and Leaf Green. It is very buggy and usually locks up at mt Moon. The creature displayed on the box cover is a character called Chaos from the game Sonic the Hedgehog.

171219.name: Pokémon Quartz
171219.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Ruby and Sapphire.




User Summary

Pokémon Quartz is a hack of Pokémon Ruby and has numerous spelling errors as a result of being translated from Spanish to English. It also contains profanity and adult themes which are absent from all official Pokémon games.

171220.name: Ghostship Aftermath
171220.description:
User Summary

Ghostship Aftermath takes place in space with limited light and oxygen. You must discover what happened and survive. The game has random events and multiple story-lines.

171221.name: Kniffel Kids
171221.description: Here fun animal dice are cast at high speed! This version of the classic game of dice will thrill even very young children.

171226.description:
Starfighter is a two-player-only game of space combat in which each player tries to assemble card combinations that deliver effective attacks on the opponent.

The original feature of the game is the fact that an effect will be triggered every time it becomes visible, that is, either when a player plays the card or when the effect icon becomes visible again after being covered. Room for combos!
171226.name: Starfighter

171228.description:
Sons of Anarchy: Men of Mayhem – Calaveras Club Expansion introduces the Calaveras Motorcycle Club to your games of Sons of Anarchy: Men of Mayhem, allowing up to five players to play at once (or six players if you already own the Grim Bastards Club expansion).

The Calaveras Club Expansion also includes the Black Market 3/4 Player Reference Card missing from many first print copies of the base game.
171228.name: Sons of Anarchy: Men of Mayhem – Calaveras Club Expansion

156091.name: Sons of Anarchy: Men of Mayhem

171229.name: Me Throw Rock
171229.description:
Lets face it, trolls are a bit grumpy and usually don't get along well with others. Fortunately for this group of disgruntled trolls they happen to be quarreling in a field full of boulders. In Me Throw Rock players play the role of trolls who happen to be in the thick of an argument that can only be settled by throwing large rocks at each other. The player who has the best accuracy wins the game!

Me Throw Rock is an eighteen card dexterity game where players throw a set of six double sided rock cards at target troll cards over a series of rounds. Every round a single target troll card is thrown onto the floor. Each player takes a turn throwing their own colored rock cards at the target card until all their cards have been thrown. The player who has the majority of three rock cards that are the closest to the target wins the round. The winner of the round collects the target card and any of the three closest cards that are showing the split side up.

The games ends after all five target troll cards have been collected or if a player has one or less rock cards to throw. After the game has ended the players must tally their points by looking at the cards they have collected. Each target troll card collected scores three points and each rock card of the players color scores one point. The player with the most points wins the game. Ties go to the player who has collected the least number of rock cards of their opponents color.

Me Throw Rock is designed to be played on the floor with a space of about 8 to 10 feet in length. However, Me Throw Rock is not limited to play on a floor and can be played on any surface with a suitable flat target area such as a table or bed.

171230.name: Word Dominoes
171230.description:
Take turns placing dominoes which link pictures together to suggest words and phrases. Earn points when others guess your phrase or when you guess someone else's phrase. Each domino consists of two simple icons placed at each end and representing common items such as "head", "house", "sun", "knife", etc.

Every person starts with two dominoes in their hand and play on a starting tableau of 4 dominoes in the center of the table. They also have pen and paper to record their guesses.

On your turn play one of your dominoes onto the tableau to form a word or phrase from the two adjacent pictures. Any combination is allowed but you're only joining two icons. Write your phrase secretly on your paper. For example, "bird" and "hand" could be "bird feeder", "a bird in the hand", "pet bird", etc.

Others now write on their papers what they think your word or phrase is. Once everyone has made their guesses score points as follows: everyone scores one point for guessing correctly, the turn player scores one point for everyone that guessed his phrase or just one point if everyone guessed his phrase. A 2 point bonus is awarded the player who solely guessed the phrase.

First player to 11 points wins the game.

171231.name: The Deep Forest
171231.description:
From the PDF

This is a map-drawing game. You collectively explore the struggles of a community of monsters, trying to rebuild and heal after driving off the human occupiers. It’s a game about community, difficult choices, and decolonization.
When you play, you make decisions about the community, decisions that get recorded on a map that is constantly evolving. Parts of the map are literal cartography, while other parts are symbolic. Players work together to create and
steer this community, but they also play devil’s advocate and introduce problems and tensions into the game.

About the Download

To download it laid out for booklet printing, print double-sided, select the flip on short-edge or bind on short-edge option.

171232.name: The Deep Forest Oracle
171232.description:
User Summary:

This item contains the tables to determine events that happen in each season during a game of the Deep Forest. It is distributed as a separate PDF, but is required to play.

190783.name: The Big Book of Madness: 2016 Greeting Card — Evil Santa

171233.description:
So far your first year at the Elementary College has been slightly disappointing. They taught you to light a flickering flame at the tip of your finger, but other than that you've spent much more time reading books than learning powerful spells as future great wizards like you should.

So when you heard about the Big Book of Madness hidden in the great school library, you couldn't help but to sneak in and peek in this intriguing tome in spite of your professors' warnings. When you slowly lift the cover of the terrible book, dozens of dreadful creatures rush out, threatening to destroy the world itself! This was your mistake, and only you can fix it now! Learn from the library to fight back against the monsters, and try not to sink into insanity...

The Big Book of Madness is a challenging co-operative game in which the players are magic students who must act as a team to turn all the pages of the book, then shut it by defeating the terrible monsters they've just freed.

Each player has their own element deck that they build during the game and use for several purposes, such as learning or casting a spell, adding a new element to their deck, destroy or healing a curse. Spells allow you to support your playmates, improve your deck, draw cards, etc. — but the monsters from the book fight back. Each comes with terrible curses that are triggered every turn unless you dispel them in time. They will make you discard elements, add madness cards to your deck, or lose spells...

If you manage to turn six pages and defeat all of the monsters, you win the game!
171233.name: The Big Book of Madness

171234.description:
For an adventurer, each day brings the same routine: grab your favorite boots, hop onto a plane to somewhere exotic, and dive right into another forgotten ruin to hunt for untold wealth. Maybe steal some other explorer’s spoils if you feel like spicing things up. At gunpoint, naturally.

Skulldug! is a pulp adventure-themed map building exploration game. Players spend action points to explore an ancient cave system, flipping over new map pieces, fighting monsters, discovering new treasure and equipment, and dropping traps for their fellow fortune-seekers.

The first player to collect three treasure and return to the cave entrance tile is crowned the winner. However, since each treasure comes with a debilitating curse for its holder, escaping the cave alive will be harder than it seems.

Microbadge
- Skulldug! Fan
171234.name: Skulldug!

171237.name: Rituals and Convergences
171237.description:
From publisher blurb:

A short magic system for Fate Core.

The rules for challenges in Fate Core make a perfect structure for performing ritual magic. Different actions can represent the hours of preparation, cleansing a ritual space, gathering materials, and so on. Rituals and Convergences presents ideas for running ritual magic challeneges, including new stunts tailored to the structure.

Rituals and Convergences also introduces the idea of the magical Convergence, a specific time imbued with magical potential (in the form of aspects and stunts) that the ritualists can use to their advantage. The magical traits you generate during the ritual challenge allow you to perform unique and powerful effects. Example aspects and stunts provide a good idea of what Convergences can do for your game.

171238.name: The Perspective (Volume 1, Issue 9 - Dec 2014)
171238.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Perspective; Final 2014 Issue. Shares general news for the path ahead in 2015.

171239.name: Reclaiming the Caves on the Borderlands
171239.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's been a year since those insipid heroes from the Keep had cleared out the caves for their own purposes. They've now been cleaned up and are home to dozens of miners and their families as a vein of silver was discovered. Well, it's time to take them back.

Reclaiming the Caves on the Borderlands is an adventure where you play the role of humanoids (orcs, goblins, etc) or traditional races as mercenaries. You must compete against other humanoid factions in an attempt to reclaim the caves for yourselves. How you do that is up to you. Do you ally with another faction? Do you manage to gain control of the caves before the Keep's forces manage to rally an attacking force?

This adventure is compaitble with the 5th edition of the world's most famous role-playing game. So shake up your traditional dungeon crawl with something different. Most of the individual caves are not predetermined for you. Instead, use the tables as a guide, or just come with your own inhabitants to stock the dungeon which whatever feels best for your interests.

171240.name: Dirigible
171240.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a full-color, 16 x 10 inch map of a Dirigible, and includes the VTT (Virtual Table top) files.

“Damn, the Allies attempt to seize our blimp! You there, stop them! Nothing can halt our advance towards the bomb drop site. Death to London!”

Take to the air and float into the skies above with our dirigible!

Dirigible is a single interior map of a gondola undercarriage attached to the bottom of the blimp’s airbag.

Dirigible is intended for historical, pulp, steampunk, and modern games.

Adventure hook for this map:

Zeppelin Terror: The Nazis decide to send a new weapon of terror during the Battle of Britain. A zeppelin with a payload of bombs in the luggage section! The crew is an experienced Luftwaffe pilot with a crew of eleven Fallschirmjaeger paratroopers equipped with Luger pistols, Messer gravity knives, and parachutes. The zeppelin is escorted by a fleet of Messerschmitt Bf 110 Zerstorer fighter bombers whose orders are to get the zeppelin to London by blasting any Spitfires out of the sky with any surviving Messerschmitts dropping their payload at that time. This daring nighttime raid must not succeed!

The Player Characters can play as Spitfire pilots trying to blow up the Messerschmitts and get to the zeppelin and/or the paratroopers that are sent up in a cargo plane to board the zeppelin. With the zeppelin over England, they are ordered to capture the zeppelin rather than destroy it since if it crashes it may be worse than the Hindenburg disaster. With the Allies closing in, the Nazis try and hold them off and drop their payload before their pilot changes the trajectory of the zeppelin down towards London!

171241.name: Oldfashioned Avenue
171241.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 233rd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features two variations of an oldfashioned avenue.

Both variations of the map are 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. They are provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include two large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4320x4032 pixels in size at 144dpi.

rpgseries.26565: Far Away Land RPG Adventure Module

171242.name: Journey Into the White
171242.description:
From publisher blurb:

The frozen wastes of the north are no place for the weak of spirit. Grab your coat and your hiking gear and get ready to take a cold trip into an untamed land as you make your journey to the renowned Winter Tournament. In this Far Away Land RPG adventure module your party will face all manner of terrible creatures as they walk headlong into a fury of winter terror.

171243.name: Cultist
171243.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Eldritch Gods Shall Return...

With the Cultist, a full 12-level class for use with Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games, you'll discover the power and terror of ancient gods and unfathomable dieties. The Cultist draws their power from their silver tongue and willing sacrifices to empower magic most unnatural.

171244.name: The Burning Plains Campaign Setting (1st Edition)
171244.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Burning Plains is a campaign setting for Devil’s Crossroad.

Explore the endless plains, winding rivers, dense forests, and looming mountains of the old west. Visit boomtowns and thriving cities, or venture into deserted ghost towns where secrets may be buried.

Gunfighters, lawmen, outlaws, miners, prostitutes, bounty hunters, and much much more can all be found in the Burning Plains.

171245.name: Snelbieden
171245.description:
Snelbieden is a fast paced card game focused on trick-taking.
The game originated in East-Flanders, Belgium as a pub game.

The goal is to bid on how many points you will be able to get, and then get those points through trick-taking. Everyone starts at 41 points, the first one to get to 0 points wins.

It can be played with a standard card game deck, using 32 cards (from 7 to aces).

171246.name: Morningstar Saloon (1st Edition)
171246.description:
From publisher blurb:

A complete Old West saloon. Complete with NPC’s, adventure hooks, and bar games.

The Morningstar might be the base of operations for the players or just a place to come in for drinks. When the drinks are flowing and the cards are on the table, who knows what will happen?

171247.name: Devil's Crossroad Western RPG 2nd Edition
171247.description:
From publisher blurb:

Devil's Crossroad 2e is a pen and paper role playing game set in the exciting world of the American Wild West.

Create a cowboy, a lawman, a prospector, a gambler, or any other character you can imagine. The trail to adventure is waiting.

The core rules are here for creating characters and running the game, character sheets, a preview of the Burning Plains setting, and a character creation calculator for Excel.

171248.name: Outlaws of the Burning Plains (2nd Edition)
171248.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Outlaws roam the Burning Plains. Some are vile and evil, others are simply desperate. The ruthless Alexander Justice, folk heroes the Jackson Brothers, the brutal Ezekiel Trapper, the deceptive Bonnie Carpenter. These outlaws might make deadly enemies of any group of players, or become strange allies to those willing to ride beyond law and order.

171249.name: The Burning Plains Western Setting (2nd Edition)
171249.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Burning Plains is an area full of conflict and adventure. Powerful business interests attempt to carve out civilization from a frontier, Native American's struggle for their survival, ruthless outlaws are steal and murder below the western sun, and a handful of lawmen try to maintain order in a chaotic wilderness.

The Burning Plains is not a place for the weak or the careless. It is a harsh setting with looming mountains, dark forests, abandoned ghost towns, burning deserts, and powerful ambition.

This second edition of the setting contains revised descriptions of the setting, updated rules, and color maps. If you have the first edition already, you may not need this product.

171250.name: Devil's Crossroad Western RPG 3rd Edition Core Rulebook
171250.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wild west. Cowboys and gunslingers do battle with gamblers and bounty hunters on a vast the untamed wilderness of the American west.

Create a cowboy, a lawman, a prospector, a gambler, or any other character you can imagine. The trail to adventure is waiting.

171251.name: The Burning Plains (3rd Edition)
171251.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Burning Plains is a campaign setting for Devil’s Crossroad.

Explore the endless plains, winding rivers, dense forests, and looming mountains of the old west. Visit boomtowns and thriving cities, or venture into deserted ghost towns where secrets may be buried.

Gunfighters, lawmen, outlaws, miners, prostitutes, bounty hunters, and much much more can all be found in the Burning Plains.

The Plains have never been bigger with new towns and strange settlements to explore.

171252.name: Ochrynn: Ilviran Abbey
171252.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ochrynn is a religious community dedicated to Ilvir, one of the Hârnic deities. The abbey is just a half league northwest of the Pit of Araka-Kalai, the home of Ilvir and an important pilgrimage destination. Ochrynn is the only civilized human settlement in the Misyn region and its clerics are involved in supplying Ivashu, bizarre and often dangerous creatures created by Ilvir, to the Pamesani arenas of western Hârn, a practice that is opposed by some Ilvirans. The location offers a wealth of adventure possibilities, whether exploring the Misyn wilderness, dealing with abbey intrigues, trading in Ivashu, or as a stop-over for visits to Araka-Kalai.

The Ochrynn article describes the history, government, and economics of the settlement. Full descriptions and color floor plans are provided for the abbey buildings and many of the settlement's craftsmen and other establishments are described. Also includes color GM and player maps.

The majority of this article was originally published in 1987 as part of the Araka-Kalai module.

171253.name: Anisha: Earthmaster Site
171253.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anisha is a site of Earthmaster origin at the northern end of Direna Lake in the Felsha Mountains. The site’s environs are quite heavily forested but the visible buildings seem well preserved. There are extensive passages beneath these structures. The ranges of three gargun nations intersect in the vicinity of Anisha. With Araka-Kalai, home to the god Ilvir, not far to the north, the Direna Valley receives an undue share of migratory Ivashu, the strange creatures created by the deity.

The nearby village of Haruch is linked to Anisha by an extensive network of game-trails. Its inhabitants, the Mendar-Haruchi tribe, claim descent from the servants of Anisha’s original inhabitants, who were godlike in their abilities. They consider the ruins sacred and believe it their duty to preserve and protect them for their masters’ anticipated return.

The Anisha article describes the history of the site and provides descriptions and floor plans for the most important buildings, as well as color GM and player maps.

This article was originally published in 1984 as part of Encyclopedia Hârnica 2.

171254.name: Kethira: Hârn's Planet
171254.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kethira is the planet on which the island of Hârn is found. This article provides a brief overview of the planet and its continents, with descriptions and color maps of the planet's vegetation, winds, currents, and tectonics. Also included are details of the Nolomar solar system, including charts of the stars and constellations of Kethira's northern and southern skies.

This article was originally published in 1990 as part of HârnWorld 2nd Edition.

171255.name: Echelon Explorations: Polyhedral Pantheon Worksheets
171255.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each book of Echelon Explorations is written to help a game master or world builder develop the world the player characters explore.

Echelon Explorations: Polyhedral Pantheons describes a process that can help develop a robust and varied pantheon, a set of deities to be worshipped by a culture in the setting.

The process depends on the relationship between the points and faces on various polyhedra, and benefits from visual reminders and means of tracking the decisions made.

This PDF contains worksheets to make this easy. Two worksheets are provided for the various polyhedra available (d20, d12, d10, d8, an alternate d8, d6, and d4), one ‘left-handed’ and one ‘right-handed’.

Each worksheet describes how the polyhedron might be a good choice for your application, contains a diagram showing the location of each point and face, and suggests alignment placement for most complete alignment coverage.

171256.name: Qbeh-1: The Atlas Cube
171256.description:
You step out of the embrace of the gate’s glow and look around in wonder. This world in the sky still inspires awe in you each day you traverse it. Blocks held together by an unseen force that is starting to fade and break away….

QBEH-1: The Atlas Cube will take players on an inspired quest through a variety of divergent worlds, each filled with new mysteries and secrets to uncover. In each world there will be special cubes that must be collected and used to navigate to the next portal. Some cubes will simply be used as stepping stones to new areas while others are imbued with magical properties such as light, gravity and propulsion.

Developed by Liquid Flower Games, QBEH-1: The Atlas Cube is a prequel to their much beloved Qbeh. What started as a 4 level student project, Qbeh soon found its way online and into the hands of gamers and journalists alike who wanted more after feasting on this appetizer. QBEH-1 builds off the core concept and aesthetics introduced in the original and brings even more polish and passion into the new game.

FEATURES:


Solve elaborate puzzles using a variety of Cube types such as Building Blocks, Energy Cubes and Gravity Manipulators


Explore atmospheric Worlds, each with 6 challenging levels and unique themes

Experience an immersive & mesmerizing Soundtrack




Discover alternate paths, intriguing platforming elements and secrets to unlock an unfolding mystery

Experience an immersive & mesmerizing Soundtrack that pulls you into the adventure
Uncover the game’s narrative through interpretive imagery




Steam Features include Achievements, Trading Cards and Controller Support

Source: The Publisher Website.

171258.name: Cabaret
171258.description:
Paris! The city of lights, the city of romance, the city of cabaret! Entertainers from all over the globe come to the city in hopes of becoming a star of the famous cabaret stages. Talent agents like you are there, too, looking for the best acts to sign to their agency.
