Uses: Create coastlines and beaches, with long stretches of imposing cliffs and dangerous rocks.. Vikings, pirates, smugglers, D-Day - anything can use cliffs!

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, in both gridded and gridless versions. (n.b. gridless version only in jpeg format)

171355.name: Coast: Small Islands
171355.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable geomorphic battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: 5 islands (3 10x10, and 2 10x20) battlemaps showing depicting small islands. Some islands are empty wilderness, whilst others feature ancient ruins (also includes plain water tile)

Uses: Pirates, smugglers, adventurers - everyone needs to visit a small island! Combine with other maps in the 'Coasts' range.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, in both gridded and gridless versions. (n.b. gridless version only in jpeg format)

171356.description:
As the legend goes, Jason was a prince of Iolkos. His father Aeson, the king, was dethroned by Pelias, the king’s brother. The usurper Pelias gave Aeson his word that when Jason will come of age, he will give crown and throne to the young prince, but that was a promise he did not intend to keep. When Jason, a young man now, confronted Pelias and asked him to honor his word, the usurper tasked Jason with a seemingly impossible quest to prove that he is worthy of the throne of Iolkos. He had to recover the Golden Fleece from the distant city of Kolchis. Jason accepted and sent word to famous heroes to aid him in his quest. Hercules, Orpheus, the brothers Kastor and Polydefkis, Laertes the father of Ulysses, were some of the 50 heroes who answered Jason’s call and joined him in his noble quest on board the legendary ship “Argo”.

Argonauts is a cooperative game that requires careful strategic planning and just a bit of luck, as even the best laid plans, can fall victim to the wrath of the Gods. The game’s objectives are to acquire the Golden Fleece and return safely to Iolkos without losing Argo or too many members of her crew. Each player controls heroes that participated in the Argonaut campaign, each with his / her own set of skills and special abilities. Following the journey from the myth, the Argonauts must face mythical monsters like Scylla and Harybdis, Harpies, Sirens, the construct Talos and the dragon guarding the Fleece, not to mention the perilous journey full of lethal encounters with merciless pirates or having to weather destructive thunderstorms all the while making sure their cargo hold is well stocked with the necessary supplies for the journey to and from Kolchis and their ship sea-worthy.

Each turn, the players must decide which of their characters will participate in the encounter they face, dealing with threats with either might or cunning and keeping in mind that these characters will be unavailable to face the next encounter due to exhaustion. But the Argonauts are not alone in their quest. The Gods occasionally take interest in their actions, either helping or hindering the progress of our heroes, laying careful plans to waste…
171356.name: Argonauts

171357.description:
Promotional game for Estonian Business software company Directo.

There are piece of map with Finland and Baltic States on the board. Each player has 6 bidding cards in hand: 4 cards with destination cities and two special cards:
"Any city" allows You to move to any city what is not destination for any other player this round.
and "Trouble" moves the specialists/deals on the board.

In each round new specialists/deals appears on the board. Players choose one of their cards and try to hire a specialists for his company or make a good business deals.
They reveal the destinations simultanously.
If only one player chooses the destination he gets all specialists/deals from that city.
If more than one specialist choose the destination they share the profit but make blind offer for the specialist(s). Who offer more money puts it on the bank and hires the specialist to his company.

The more different specialists You have the more money You earn at the end of each round. But beware to hire same kind of specialist already working in Your company - both leave!

After six rounds the player with the most money wins.
171357.name: Directo lauamäng

171360.name: It's Time to Conquer Earth!
171360.description:
It's Time to Conquer Earth is a card and dice game, where you play the part of a wacky alien, scrambling to get a foothold on earth for your impending invasion before those silly humans realize what you are up to and retaliate.

Players take turns rolling their ships, (represented as dice of varying sizes,) to either abduct numerous different characters on the board, ranging from cows to kings, or to acquire tech, which is used to buy bigger and better ships, or to play one of the cards special to your given alien race. These cards will let you modifiy your rolls, make different characters easier to abduct, let you mess with other people's ships, and numerous other effects.

Characters have varying difficulties, representing how well you have to roll to abduct them. You start out with a 6 sided die, but you may buy larger dice with tech as the game progresses. Upon abducting a character, you may choose to brainwash them, netting you influence points, or you may choose to keep them contained to take advantage of their various effects.

Each time a character is abducted, the threat level goes up, representing how aware the humans are of your shenanigans. As the threat gets higher, so to does the difficulty of the game, as the humans start to retaliate or protect themselves in different ways. The game ends once the threat reaches 100, where the humans are finally acutely aware of your presence and ready to retaliate. At that time, each player counts up their influence points, and the player with the most influence points wins!

171361.name: Spy Tag
171361.description:
Spy Tag is a high-speed race to spot the spies and tag them before time's up!

To play, deal an even number of agent files to all players (the masterminds), who lay these agent files in front of them, face up, then set the timer. The first mastermind draws a spy card from the pile, scans the other player's agent files for the matching card, then slaps the spy card on top of the appropriate one. The mastermind who just got slapped is next to pull a spy card, and play continues until the timer goes off. The player with a spy card covering one of their agent files when the timer goes off must pull a card from the secret attaché. If the card is empty, the player is safe; if the card shows the stolen gizmo, that player is out and play continues until only one spy remains standing – the winner!

171362.description:
The kids in Unser Baumhaus want to build a treehouse in the garden, and plenty of nails and wood boards are available in the tool shed. To build the floor of a treehouse, you must first install four wood dice, then combine three building tiles in the proper order. Time is short, though, as dark clouds are covering the sky, signaling an oncoming storm.

If players manage to finish at least one level of the treehouse and put a roof in place, they win the game together.
171362.name: Unser Baumhaus

171363.description: This a set of 84 wooden bullets to replace the cardboard bullets included in the base game and 6-player expansion.

boardgameaccessory.149097: Spurs: A Tale in the Old West

171363.name: Spurs: Wood Bullets

171364.name: CineCats
171364.description:
CineCats (Micettini) is a very easy game to test your skills in describing,listening,singing,interpreting,observing...

You must figure out the CineCat as suggested by the dealer, who can describe it with the help of the illustration on the card, a verb, a sound, miming it, singing it, or reciting a "quote" from a movie!

The player who knows the game best starts as dealer: he shuffles the deck and places a dozen cards face up on the table.

The first player who uses his hand to cover the correct card, wins that cards and takes it for a victory point!

As soon as a card is guessed and taken, the dealer re-fills the table with a new card, until all the cards are taken. In the end, the player with the most cards... is the winner!

When the players have learned how to call, describe, mime, sing or quote the CineCats, every time a gamer takes a card, he becomes the dealer and describes the next CineCat;
of course the dealer on his turn can’t be the one to cover the card he just called!

And if someone slaps his hand on a wrong card... He must replace one of his cards on the table!

171365.name: The Game of MVP Dating
171365.description:
From the box:

"MVP Date before it's too late! MVP Dating prepares you to be the best in the game by giving you chances to gain and use Morals, Values and Principles (MVPs) in dating scenarios.

The Game of MVP Dating is a roll-and-move game. The object is to master the outer "date-for-fun" path by accumulating three "dating experiences" chips and gaining 5 morals, values and principles (MVPs) cards. Players may use MVP cards to avoid negative "1-on-1" dating experience card penalties or to dump a date. When a player has accumulated the correct number of dating experiences and MVP cards he or she can move to the inner "Get Married" track. when they land on a "Get Married" space and have only one date left, they may stay on the space until they roll a 6 to get married and win the game.

This game is designed to teach dating morals and values to unmarried teens and young adults with the ultimate goal being marriage.

171366.name: The Amazing Spider-Man

boardgamecompilation.222589: Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book

171366.description:
Publisher's description: "Find your way to the center of the web! Spider-Man's spider-sense is going crazy! Mysterio, Master of Illusion, is up to his dirty tricks again. He has hypnotized everyone in New York City in order to trap Spider-Man. Hobgoblin, Venom, Carnage, and Green Goblin are also on the loose. Only you can help Spider-Man and Black Cat stop Mysterio and restore peace to the city."

The Amazing Spider-Man was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. This is a fairly standard roll-and-move game where players use an attached "electronic die" to move their pieces around a spiral spiderweb toward to the center. Various spaces on the board move players back or forward or cause players to gain or lose a turn. First player to the center captures Mysterio and wins.

171367.description:
As in Spoons, players in Tortenschlacht want to collect all the cards of one type in their hand.

To start the game, take all the cards for one type of pastry for each player in the game, shuffle them, then deal a hand of five cards to each player. On a turn, all players simultaneously pass a card to their left-hand neighbor, and they continue this process until one player has all five cards of the same type in her hand. She then slaps the pie plate in the center of the table, after which all of the other players do so. Whoever slaps last gets a cake stamped on her hand, then players shuffle the cards for another round.

As soon as one player has five stamps on her hand, the game ends and whoever has the fewest stamps wins.
171367.name: Tortenschlacht

171368.description:
SOLOmino is a Mau Mau variant that replaces the standard numbered and colored cards with domino-style cards that feature a colored number on each half of them — although some cards also feature action symbols that put twists on gameplay.

To start, each person takes a hand of eight cards. On a turn, a player either draws a card from the deck and adds it to her hand, or she plays one card from her hand onto one or two cards already in play. When you cover a card already in play, the half of your card doing the covering must match the covered card in either number or color. If the card you play features an action symbol, that action takes effect immediately, skipping the next player's turn, changing the order of play, forcing the next player to draw cards, swapping hands with other players, and so on. As soon as a player's hand is empty, she wins.

SOLOmino includes a variant that allows a player to play out of turn if she can play a card that matches a card in both color and number. When this happens, the player lays down the card as if it were her turn, then the next player in clockwise order takes the next turn.
171368.name: SOLOmino

171369.name: Schlafmütze
171369.description:
In Schlafmütze, players try to dump the cards from their personal draw piles as quickly as possible, preferably by dumping them on other players.

The deck consists of one hundred cards, with five copies each of cards numbered 1-20. Place the five 1s in the center of the table, then shuffle the remaining cards and deal them out among the players, with each player forming a face-down draw pile. On a turn, a player first sees whether she can play the top card of her discard stack onto a pile in the center of the table (with numbers always being placed in ascending order) or on an opponent's discard pile (with both ascending and descending plays being valid). After this, the player draws her top card and plays it in a similar manner, if possible. If a player has a choice of location, she chooses as she wishes.

If someone makes a mistake when playing a card, any opponent can shout "Schlafmütze", then all of the opponents give the top card of their deck to the player who goofed.

If a player empties her draw deck, she flips over her discard stack at the start of her next turn. As soon as a player is out of cards, that player wins the game.

Schlafmütze is a slightly altered remake of a traditional card game, so no designer is credited for it.

171370.name: Kingdom Rush Origins

videogamehonor.26796: 2014 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee

171370.description:
User Summary

Kingdom Rush Origins is the third game in the Kingdom Rush series of tower defense games. The game is presented as a series of stages where you must keep enemies from exiting the level. Towers can be placed on fixed positions along the paths to attack enemies.

171372.name: Corporate Ladder
171372.description:
From the back cover:

A game for two or more enterprising players, Corporate Ladder combines general knowledge, business sense, gut instinct and the wisdom of experience to take you from the company mail room to the loftiest position of all -- Chairman of the Board.

Should you consider inviting your boss and his or her spouse to a cocktail party in your own home?

What's the difference between a golden parachute and the golden handcuffs?

How many semester hours do most MBA degrees require?

Do you know the original name of the Amex?

What's the most common flaw in an executive's attire?

Answers to 1800 questions like these may surprise you as you scratch and claw your way to the top playing Corporate Ladder. You'll have to make decisions on office politics, corporate etiquette, personnel, finance and banking, manufacturing, advertising, accounting and many more.

Corporate Ladder is ideal for families, cocktail parties, business groups and students. Scheme, perform, wriggle, wend your way to the top, and once you get there, don't look back. Somebody might be gaining on you!

171373.name: Pokémon Shiny Gold
171373.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Red and Blue.




User Summary

Pokémon Shiny Gold is a total conversion of Pokémon FireRed that turns the game into a Gold and Silver remake, much like how FireRed is a remake of Pokémon Red. It introduced features that allow Pokémon that normally evolve via time-based events or trade to evolve by other methods that are more easily available to the player. The game also was remade and released as Pokémon Shiny Gold X.

171374.name: Crime & Time
171374.description:
From the front cover:
Experience Court and Jail Procedures!
Object: life and crime, court action, detention. Player with most money at game end is winner. Game can be played in short amount of time or can be lengthy - you decide.
Equipment: Game board, player pieces, sentence log, playing money, sentencing cards, appeal/parole cards and pair of dice.

User Description:
Roll and move game where players go along the outer track receiving money for various life events, but also are at risk of being convicted of various crimes. Cards from the "Sentencing" pile determine how long a player must go to jail (i.e. the inner track) or whether they have received probation. Various spaces on the inner track (each circuit around being one year) also earn you money and random card draws may win you appeals, probation, or an overturn of your conviction. Score sheets ("Sentence log") allow players to keep track of all the crimes they've been convicted of and how much time they've served for each. According to the game rules, there is no set goal; players must agree on a length of time to play or an amount of money to reach first.

The game is apparently intended as a criticism of the lenient "revolving door" of the U.S. criminal justice system, similar to "Capital Punishment" or "Public Assistance." Although the game was made in 1995, it fails to take into account the then new but growing "three strikes" system in many states, as well as criminal court's tendency to impose harsher sentences on repeat offenders.

171375.name: Pokémon Brown
171375.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Red and Blue.




User Summary

Pokémon Brown is a hack of Pokémon Red. This hack began as a sequel to the "Fukémon" hack, titled "Fukémon 2". It completely changed all the maps, made minor script tweaks, and almost all the Pokémon sprites have been changed. Pokémon Brown takes place in the Rijon region. A remake was made that contains second and fourth generation Pokémon, new areas, several glitch repairs, new features, and new additions to the storyline.

171376.name: Pokémon Adventure
171376.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Sonic 3D Blast 5.




User Summary

Pokémon Adventure is a hack of a pirated game called Sonic Adventure 7 for the Game Boy Color. It has five levels and the intro sequence consists of a few Japanese Pokédex screenshots from Gold and Silver. Other than the intro, title screen, and ending, the game has almost no relationship to Pokémon. While the game is paused, one can move themselves away from enemies.

171377.name: Hilarious Health care
171377.description:
1994 anti-nationalized healthcare game in response to the early, failed attempts by the Clinton administration to introduce a system like Obamacare.

The object of the game is to outlive the other players and benefit the most, financially, from a nationalized healthcare system. The instruction book is filled with right-wing sarcasm -- the playing pieces represent various tropes like "pork barrel" etc. -- and the cards punish or benefit players (ala Community Chest and Chase) using hypothetical examples of pro-liberal or anti-conservative bias in the Federal government's bureaucracy.

Around the board, players get appointed to various positions in the healthcare bureaucracy and suffer various illnesses. Each "position" has two spaces to win appointments to (rather than purchasing like in Monopoly), and unlucky players who land on your department have to pay their healthcare fees to you. Beware of getting caught in the inner circle of healthcare waiting periods!

This game is similar in tone to Public Assistance or Capital Punishment, in both its conservative/Republican anger and its cringe-worthy cards and spaces.

171378.name: Pokémon Prism
171378.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Gold and Silver.




User Summary

Pokémon Prism is a hack of Pokémon Gold that takes place in a new region called Naljo, with new music, Pokémon from the first four generations, and new Pokémon types. One feature is to replace the player's sprite with another at a special shop. The game also has crafting systems and the ability to send a Pokémon out of its Poké Ball outside of battle.

171379.name: Public Utility
171379.description: Object: to obtain as much money as possible. Each player is a ripped off customer at the start of the game. You can advance to a higher pay rate by drawing a Ripoff or Profit card giving you a promotion, or by landing on a space indicating that you are hired or promoted to that particular pay status. Land on the Stock Market space and you get to play the stock market.

171380.name: Pokémon Marble
171380.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Red and Blue.




User Summary

Pokémon Marble was made as a sequel to Pokémon Quartz and uses Pokémon Fire Red as a base. It has a new Rival, new maps and graphics, a new plot, and more than 250 fake Pokémon. It takes place 20 years after Quartz and starts this time in Lowheaven.

171381.name: Pokémon Arcoiris
171381.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Ruby and Sapphire.




User Summary

Pokémon Arcoiris is a hack of Pokémon ruby. The game takes place on the Orange Islands, following the storyline of the anime's second season. It features a dark lugia on the cover art.

171382.name: Pocket Monster
171382.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon RPG.




User Summary

The player controls Pikachu through numerous sidescrolling levels. There are 5 levels in total, with a boss at the end of each, as well a mini-boss in the first level of the Mega Drive version. Pikachu can jump on enemies and use a special move which clears all of the enemies on the screen, although the latter can only be done when the charge meter is full.

171383.name: Pokémon 4-in-1
171383.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon RPG.




User Summary

Pokémon 4-in-1 is a pirated NES game which included four mini-games: "PicaClick", "PicaSlot", "PicaDance" (called "PiraDance" in game), and "Pacman". It used the animated sprite of the title screen Pikachu from Pokémon Yellow in the background.

171384.name: Pokémon Blaze Black and Volt White
171384.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Black and White.




User Summary

Pokémon Blaze Black and Volt White are hacks of Pokémon Black and White that are generally the same, with no changes to the story or mechanics. The main changes made by these games is that it is possible to obtain all 649 Pokémon in the National Pokédex without connecting to another game. All the legendary Pokémon that do not appear normally in the original now have a small chance of appearing in certain locations. Many evolution methods were changed and the difficulty increased.

171385.name: Shuffle My Little Pony
171385.description:
Princess Celestia has used her magic to break the many gems in Equestria in half so the ponies can enjoy collecting them. Each pony has its own special gem to collect. Match as many as you can to win the game.
Take the top card from your pile. Try to create whole gems of your ponies’ colours, making sure that whenever you place a card, any sides that are touching match each other.

171386.name: Golden Nugget 64
171386.description:
Golden Nugget 64 is a multi-player virtual casino video game for the Nintendo 64. It was developed by Westwood Studios, published by Electronic Arts, and was released on December 1, 1998 in North America. Golden Nugget 64 is unique because it is the only gambling/casino game released in North America for the Nintendo 64.[1] The game starts off by having the player create an account with $1000 which is saved on the controller pack. Players have the choice from one of ten different popular casino games. Each game has its own set of rules and a guide to learn how to play.

Source: Wikipedia, "Golden Nugget 64", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

171387.name: Korea: Race to Pusan
171387.description:
Korea: Race to Pusan is a low complexity wargame covering the Battle of Pusan Perimeter. The game includes an 11x17 map, countersheet, and 4 pages of rules. The game uses the standard WWII rules found in the TwoBuckGames WWII Series.

Each player has an objective that he or she must meet in order to win - either number of units destroyed or occupying certain hexes. Each counter can move one hex per turn. The combat is a simple system in which the players must roll greater than or equal to the number printed on the counter to achieve a hit.

171388.name: American War of Independence: Brandywine

boardgamefamily.26575: TwoBuckGames American War of Independence Series

171388.description:
Brandywine is a large scale game of the early Revolutionary war using the rules from the American War of Independence Campaign Sets. The game is approximately three times as large as those found in the Campaign Sets.

The game includes an 11x17 inch map, counter sheet, and three pages of rules.

Players take turns moving their forces and attacking enemy units in order to achieve the specific objectives for a battle. One important difference to typical wargames is that before the moving player can attack, his units are subject to defensive fire from the opponent.

171389.name: American War of Independence: Campaign Set 4 – More Battles

boardgamefamily.26575: TwoBuckGames American War of Independence Series

171389.description:
Nine battles of the early Revolutionary war using a common set of rules. Each battle includes its own specific rules page and map.

Battles included in this set include Monmouth (initial), Monmouth (final), Harlem Heights, Fort Washington, Ticonderoga Defiant, Paulus Hook, Red Bank, Bound Brook, Fort Clinton.

Players take turns moving their forces and attacking enemy units in order to achieve the specific objectives for a battle. One important difference to typical wargames is that before the moving player can attack, his units are subject to defensive fire from the opponent.

171390.description:
Nine battles of the early Revolutionary war using a common set of rules. Each battle includes its own specific rules page and map.

Battles included in this set include White Marsh, Bennington, Princeton, Kettle Creek, Burgoynes Stand, Barren Hill, Brooklyn, the Clouds, and Springfield.

Players take turns moving their forces and attacking enemy units in order to achieve the specific objectives for a battle. One important difference to typical wargames is that before the moving player can attack, his units are subject to defensive fire from the opponent.
171390.name: American War of Independence: Campaign Set 3 – Other Battles

boardgamefamily.26575: TwoBuckGames American War of Independence Series

171391.description:
Ten battles of the early Revolutionary war using a common set of rules. Each battle includes its own specific rules page and map.

Battles included in this set include Charleston, Cowpens, Eutaw Springs, Camden, Guildford Courthouse, Kings Mountain, Hobkirk Hill, Yorktown, Gloucester Point, and Cornwallis breaks out (hypothetical scenario).

Players take turns moving their forces and attacking enemy units in order to achieve the specific objectives for a battle. One important difference to typical wargames is that before the moving player can attack, his units are subject to defensive fire from the opponent.
171391.name: American War of Independence: Campaign Set 2 – The Southern Theatre

boardgamefamily.26575: TwoBuckGames American War of Independence Series

171392.name: Vinegar Hill
171392.description:
Vinegar Hill is a low complexity wargame covering the Australian Castle Hill Convict Rebellion of 1804. The game includes an 11x17 map, countersheet, and 3 pages of rules. The game is based on Peter Schutze's Eureka Stockade.

Each player has an objective that he or she must meet in order to win - either number of units destroyed or occupying certain hexes. Each counter can move one hex per turn. The combat is a simple system in which the players must roll greater than or equal to the number printed on the counter to achieve a hit.

171393.name: Bedlam
171393.description:
Bedlam is a card-shedding party game with ever-changing rules.

Players are dealt a hand of cards at the beginning of the game and play same suit or number onto the discard pile if they can. However each player has their own rules card (e.g. When playing a red card, players must say 'better red than dead!') which they enforce by giving penalty cards to players who do not abide by them. There is also a shared rule card visible to all players.

The first player to get rid of all their cards is the winner.

171394.name: sLAng: A quemarropa
171394.description:
Publisher Blurb

sLAng: A quemarropa es una introducción al juego de rol sLAng, que ofrece una visión rápida y trepidante de la ambientación del juego y las reglas básicas para empezar a jugar.


in English

"sLAng: A quemarropa" is an introduction to RPG Slang, offering a quick and exciting vision of the atmosphere of the game and start playing basic rules.

rpgitemversion.263189: Seis balas: munición para tus partidas de sLAng

171395.name: Seis balas
171395.description:
From Publisher Blurb:

Seis autores, seis aventuras listas para jugar, seis perspectivas, seis descargas de pura adrenalina... ¿demasiado plomo para ti?

"Seis balas" es el nuevo suplemento del aclamado juego de género negro sLAng: Historias sobre una misma historia y ofrece al Director de Juego seis trepidantes historias autoconclusivas, incluyendo los personajes que las protagonizan, para que tu grupo de juego pueda sumergirse en la vertiginosa acción cinematográfica de sLAng sin ningún esfuerzo.

En "Seis balas" encontrarás:


Dinero Sucio: Solo iba a ser otro viaje de autobús, un viaje largo y aburrido a través de un desolador paisaje desértico... pero cuando algo inesperado sucede, un grupo de desconocidos que no tienen aparecentemente nada en común puede terminar unido por una emoción mucho más fuerte que la amistad, más fuerte que el odio, más fuerte que la curiosidad, más fuerte que el miedo: la codicia.
Pequeña Salem: Hace veinte años el barrio de Pequeña Salem era un lugar muy diferente, un lugar en el que la banda del Samaritano lo controlaba todo y, al mismo tiempo, velaba por que nada malo le ocurriera a la gente del barrio. Pequeña Salem era un lugar con sus propias leyes, pero era un lugar seguro. Pero el Samaritano acabó entre rejas y a los que le conocieron en aquella época les costaría reconocer en él al hombre que, con sus creencias, está convulsionando el penal de San Jerónimo.
Trapos Sucios: Los problemas existen hasta en las mejores familias. Cuando además los problemas son con tu familia política (en el sentido literal del término “política”) las cosas pueden desmadrarse. Como está a punto de ocurrir en la calle 52. Trapos sucios es una historia sobre lo que ocurre cuando se combina trabajo, sentido del deber y familia, uno de esos cocktails que suele acabar realmente mal…
Encrucijada: Hay un lugar en el que las vidas de dos grupos de personas van a juntarse con un resultado fatídico. Hay un lugar en el que una granja aislada va a ser el escenario del milagro de la vida y del de la muerte. Hay un lugar en el que siete personas sin nada que perder van a lanzar una mirada al abismo. Ese lugar es la encrucijada.
Las apariencias engañan: Un secuestro, un robo, una joyería, tres criminales, una mujer, su marido… ¿Una historia típica de las que aparecen cada día en las noticias? Puede parecerlo, pero las cosas no siempre son lo que parecen y un plan sencillo puede convertirse en una verdadera pesadilla para todos los involucrados.
The End: El funeral de un buen amigo es un lugar perfecto para recordar el pasado, revivir los últimos momentos juntos y decidir sobre las acciones a tomar en el futuro. Pero cuando el funeral es el del líder de una banda de atracadores profesionales que ha sido brutalmente asesinado, los recuerdos no siempre son agradables y las decisiones que hay que tomar no son, precisamente, fáciles.


translation by Google

Six writers, six lists adventures to play six perspectives six bolts of pure adrenaline ... too much lead to you?

"Six Bullets" is the new supplement acclaimed game genre black slang: Stories about a common history and provides thrilling Game Director autoconclusivas six stories, including characters that star, so your gaming group can dive into the dizzying Slang action film without any effort.

In "Six Bullets" you will find:


Dirty Money: just going to be another bus trip, a long and tedious journey through a desolate desert landscape ... but when something unexpected happens, a group of strangers who do not have anything in common aparecentemente can end attached by a much stronger emotion than friendship, stronger than hate, stronger than curiosity stronger than fear: greed.
Small Salem: Twenty years ago the neighborhood of Little Salem was a very different place, a place where the band Samaritan controlled everything and at the same time, ensured that nothing bad will happen to people in the neighborhood. Small Salem was a place with its own laws, but it was a safe place. But the Samaritan ended up behind bars and those who knew him at that time would cost them to recognize him as the man who, with their beliefs, convulsing the prison of San Jeronimo.
Dirty Laundry: Problems exist even in the best families. When problems are also your political family (in the literal sense of the word "politics") things can get out of hand. As he is about to happen on the street 52. Dirty Laundry is a story about what happens when you work, sense of duty and family combines one of those cocktails that usually ends really bad ...
Crossroads: There is a place in which the lives of two groups of people are going to join a fatal outcome. There is a place in which an isolated farm will be the scene of the miracle of life and death. There is a place in which seven people with nothing to lose going to cast a glance into the abyss. That place is the crossroads.
Smoke and Mirrors: A kidnapping, robbery, a jeweler, three criminals, a woman, her husband ... A typical history of appearing every day in the news? It may seem so, but things are not always what they seem and a simple plan can become a nightmare for everyone involved.
The End: The funeral of a good friend is a perfect place to reminisce, relive the last moments together and decide on actions to take in the future. But when the funeral is the leader of a gang of professional robbers who has been brutally murdered, the memories are not always pleasant and decisions to be taken are not exactly easy.

171396.description:
3 gewinnt! ("3 wins") is a children's game similar to Connect Four.

Players take turns dropping checkers into a seven-by-six grid (the "cheese"), with the intention to make a three-in-a-row. Each checker shows a mouse: either boy or girl, and either red, green or blue. A three-in-a-row consists of three boys, three girls, or three mice in the same color. Each player has a hand of two checkers, and chooses which one to use each turn.

When a player creates a three-in-a-row, he gains a piece of cheese. Initially, these have one hole. When the pieces of cheese with a single hole run out, pieces with two holes are awarded, and when those run out, pieces with three holes are awarded.

The game ends when all the cheese has been claimed, or when the grid has been filled completely. The player with the most holes in his pieces of cheese wins.
171396.name: 3 gewinnt!

171397.name: Alle Vögel sind schon da!
171397.description:
In Alle Vögel sind schon da! players want to help all of the birds get to the party taking place at the birdhouse, but they need to ensure that the birds who show up have at least one present with them.

To set up, players lay out the bird house tile, then surround it with the double-sided bird cards, with the bird side of each card being face up. Shuffle the peephole cards, then set them as a deck to the side.

On a turn, a player sees the color of a bird or a gift peeking through the peephole on the topmost card, then chooses one of the bird cards and turns it over, announcing what's on the other side. If this matches the peephole card, then the player reverses the bird card and the next player takes a turn; if not, that bird card is removed from the game, then the player reveals one bird card after another until finding a match.

If all the peephole cards have been removed and at least one bird card is still on the table, then the players win and the birds get to go enjoy themselves at the party. If not, then the birds get to peck the players on the head in frustration.

171399.name: Year of the Yuppie Game
171399.description:
A game for 25 to 40 year olds on their way up the ladder of success. Are you a Yuppie (young urban professional)? Or do you just aspire to be one? How do Yuppies get ahead and stay ahead? Why are they so successful?

The Year of the Yuppie Game is the game of success for 25 to 40 year olds on the way up. You'll experience money--and lots of it. You'll move up the ladder of success, screwing over fellow employees, friends and relatives. You'll suffer breakups, divorces and mergers. You'll play the stock market for big stakes.

In the process, you'll laugh your head off!

Up to 5 players being the game with a car and $50,000. The first player to escape the "rat race" receives $100,000 and the game is ended. The player with the most money is declared the winner.

171400.name: Bit.Trip Complete
171400.description:
Bit.Trip Complete is a compilation of six games in the Bit.Trip series, including Bit.Trip Beat, Bit.Trip Core, Bit.Trip Void, Bit.Trip Runner, Bit.Trip Fate, and Bit.Trip Flux. It was developed by Gaijin Games for the Wii and published by Aksys in North America and Rising Star Games in Europe. Included with the game is a music CD, titled Bit.Trip Soundtrack Sampler that contains pieces from all six games.

The game also includes 20 extra "challenge levels" for each game, as well as bonus content related to the production of the games. These levels are completely new but are shorter than the already included levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bit.Trip Complete", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

171401.name: 10+ Treasures: Wonders of the Wyld
171401.description:
From publisher blurb:

Where the previous two volumes were more or less random collections of curious curios, our third magic item compilation focuses on the forest and its denizens, both mundane and magical.

Among the nearly forty magic items inside you'll find:

A staff that transforms those is slays--and even its wielder if you aren't careful--into fungus zombies.
Arrows that can pass unhindered through wood, living and dead.
A spear that can wind and twist about of its own accord, and transform into a snake.
A shield that comes to life when you attach it to a tree. It also knows a lot about the forest, if you've got the time and patience to listen to it.
A ring that makes others overlook you, for good or ill, until you make yourself known.
A scabbard made from the deadly basilisk, which even in death continues to produce a potent venom.
Mushrooms that allow you to live the memories of the deceased.
An instrument loud enough to literally wake the trees.




As with 10+ Treasures and 10+ Treasures: Volume II, there's extensive advice on making your own magic items, as well as clarifications and suggestions on how to tweak some of them to better suit your game.

171402.name: 10+ Treasures: Volume II
171402.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here is yet another collection of just over 30 magic items to tantalize your players, stock your dungeons, and—along with some extensive advice—inspire you to create your own. If you liked our first magic item compilation, then you're going to love this one (and not just because it is better organized).

Inside you'll find strange and sometimes disturbing creations, such as the soul of an intelligent sword, a shield that can spawn zombies, a living ring that turns your body into a verminous nest, another ring that makes you virtually unkillable (just don't ever take it off), and a chunk of stone that doubles as both insanity-inducing encylopedia and mutating weapon.

Like I said, you're going to love this one. Your players? Well...given the side effects of some of these things, maybe not so much.

171403.name: Vidome 123
171403.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs are pitted against bizarre alien lifeforms on a mysterious and dangerously hostile planet in a distant galaxy, where they will find a murder mystery waiting to be solved. This adventure is designed to let the PCs show off a variety of skills while simultaneously giving your players the creeps.

VIDOME 123 is a DayTrippers adventure module for 2 or more players. The tone is dark and spooky, with serious threats from inscrutable foes (both human and alien), and the plot is open-ended. This module is recommended for DayTrippers with at least one previous mission under their belt.

171404.name: Less Little
171404.description:
From publisher blurb:

On a routine Exploration mission for a reality-hopping travel agency, the crew encounters a Flux Storm and something goes horribly wrong. The PCs will find themselves in a comedic and surreal situation, trapped in a world they never made (but might recognize from childrens' literature)... and desperately seeking the way back home.

LESS LITTLE is an introductory DayTrippers adventure module for 1-2 players. The tone is dreamlike and humorous, with some mildly adult situations, and the plot is firmly guided. This module is recommended for beginning players and campaigns with a comical touch.

171405.name: Terror at Inaruk
171405.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini Quests by Survive RPG offer compelling 2 page adventures that are great for a one-off session, convention play or for use as a side quest to your campaign. Mini-Quests is designed for any D20 fantasy system. In TERROR AT INARUK the characters must travel to a remote northern village in search of a missing shipment of gemstones. Will they survive the terror that awaits?

171406.name: Everyman Archetypes: Swashbuckler
171406.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prepare to buckle your swash with Everyman Archetypes: Swashbuckler! From the mind behind the Pact Magic Unbound series and Guidance, Everyman Archetypes: Swashbuckler provides all-new options for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game's most cinematic melee class. Within Everyman Archetypes: Swashbuckler, you will find:

Six all-new swashbuckler archetypes, including the daredevil, the oppugnant duelist, and the vainglory swashbuckler, who customizes her panache with her own set of personal deeds.
A dozen new feats to customize your swashbuckler's fighting style and panache, including Two-Weapon Panache for sword-and-dagger users as well as Skillful Bravado for swashbucklers with a more skillful edge.
And much, much more!

171407.name: Quick Generator: Magic Schools & Classes
171407.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you don’t need an insane amount of tables and charts. You may just need something quick and simple to help flesh out basic details without going overboard on the details. This is where the Quick Generator is helpful, providing you with a simple one-sentence description of a particular subject.

This particular Quick Generator covers magic schools and classes, although it can also be used for book titles, spell books or anything where you need to classify a collection of magic or related items.

Example schools or classes you make with this:

Progressive Control Magic
Applied Mimicry
Demonic Shamanism

171408.name: Churimanger (Ranger Archetype)
171408.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new archetype for the Ranger class. The Churimanger couples the power of the ranger companion with the evolution pool of the eidolon.

171409.name: Ultimate Composition
171409.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roll over, Beethoven!

Compose and conduct your own masterpieces with one of four new musical base classes based on a new, freeform composition system.

In the real world, great musicians are some of the most creative people that you will ever meet. When sitting down to play one in tabletop gaming, however, musical performance boils down to a short list of canned abilities that are autogranted at particular level thresholds. In short, gaming a musician is not the creative enterprise that actually being one is.

Ultimate Composition seeks to capture the raw creativity of music with the advent of a freeform composition system. Players combine intros, melodies, and outros to compose custom scores, which are then conducted in much the same way that a bard performs his performances. Each base class contained herein takes a different spin on the concept, combining it with spellcasting, arcane magic, divine magic, or more freeform musical composition, as the case may be.

Further, Ultimate Composition's transformative archetypes are not mere flavor packages, but instead modify the very root of the composition system itself, to the point that each base class can be made almost unrecognizable by piling on two or three of them.


Ultimate Composition is part 2 of 3 of the Strange Magic project, an upcoming hardcover book that seeks to be the spiritual successor to 2006's Tome of Magic.*


Product Features:

Four base classes: the skirmishing breakdancer, the divine cantor, the multi-conducting harmonicist, and the classic maestro
Five multiclass archetypes, archetypes that are each compatible with two or more of the above classes: the masterpiece-rewriting arranger, the transformative songweaver, the music-as-magic starlet, the minelaying street performer, and the bardic performing virtuoso.
Favored Class options for all common races, as well as most featured races
Innovative scores system makes music into a tripartite system of intro, melody, and outro, then offers options to totally break that structure through transformative archetypes and specialist base classes
150+ compositions spanning a 30-page spellbook
Breakdancer dance moves system with 60 abilities
Cantor/Maestro masterpieces system with 25+ musicae sacrae/opuses
19 feats
Complete nested bookmarking, including all sidebars and tables

171410.name: "A" is for "Aliens"
171410.description:
From publisher blurb:

They Came from Outer Space!

The premier entry in the Icons A to Z series looks at aliens, including:

Alien origins
Alien qualities
Random alien creation
Running alien invasions and occupations.

171411.name: Bubble Bomb
171411.description:
In Bubble Bomb, players use their bubbles to create bombs, or perhaps set bombs off — whatever the case might be, you need to get your bubbles in order to match target bombs and win.

To set up, each player takes seven double-sided chips from a bag, with each side of the chip showing a colored symbol; nine additional chips are placed in the center of the table. Nine double-sided bomb tiles are placed to the side, and each bomb tile shows either a color or a symbol, but not both.

Everyone plays simultaneously, with each player flipping her chips one by one, flipping chips in the center of the table one by one, and swapping one of her chips for one of the publicly available chips. As soon as all seven of a player's chips match one of the target bombs — say, by being all pink or all triangles or one of each color — that player yells "Boom!" She then identifies the matching bomb, places one of her chips aside as a one-point scoring marker, draws a new chip from the bag, then flips over that bomb before play resumes.

If a player matches two bombs simultaneously — e.g., all blue and one of each symbol — she sets aside two tokens instead of one. If a players matches the Bubble Bomb, which calls for one of each color and one of each symbol, she claims the Bubble Bomb (even if another player claimed it earlier), then swaps all of her chips for seven in the middle of the table before play resumes; the Bubble Bomb is worth three points at the end of the game.

With four players, the game ends when the final chip is drawn from the bag and the player with the most points wins; with 2-3 players, the first player to collect nine points wins.

171412.name: Moonshine Run
171412.description:
The year is 1932. The Japanese have attacked Shanghai, America has a bobsledding team, the five day work week has begun, and Prohibition is in full swing. All in all it is a good year and tonight you have to collect the White Lightning. These Tennessee Mountains are full of moonshiners waiting for you to transport their shine. Now all you have to do is brave the dangers and make it back. You are not alone and, although others might not be as brave as you are, some might be smarter. You have to get more shine then they do and buy back the farm.

Moonshine Run is a game about both luck and guts, where each player is racing down the mountain to deliver their Moonshine to their customers. Along the way, they can pick up more Moonshine Jugs and different Items that may help them out. However, there is also hazards up on the mountain that could cause the player to lose their turn and any Moonshine Jugs they have collected.

There are seven rounds during a game of Moonshine Run. Each round, a player pays Moonshine Dollars to access Road Card. Each road card if flipped as it is drawn. A play may come across some Moonshine Jugs, Item Cards or Hazard Cards. It is up to the player to decide when enough is enough and to call it quits.

This is a fast, press your luck game where you must know when to stop.

171413.name: GeoCards Europa
171413.description:
GeoCards Europa includes 47 cards with which players can play three games that challenge their geographical knowledge about Europe. Each card is double-sided, with the outline of a country, its name, its population and its size on one side of the card and its capital and the surrounding countries on the other. In all three games, whoever collects the most cards wins.

In the first game, shuffle the cards with the capitals face-up, then take turns naming the country depicted on the card. Guess right and you claim the card; otherwise, remove the card from the game.

In the second game, deal the cards out evenly among the players with the capitals face-up. On a turn, you hold one of your cards capital side-out toward your left-hand opponent. If he can name one of the countries adjacent to the depicted country, he claims the card; if not, the next opponent in clockwise order can try to do so. Remove the card from the game if no one guesses correctly.

In the third game, deal ten cards capital side-up to each player. On a turn, choose two cards and hold them out to your left-hand opponent. If he can guess which country is larger in size or population (depending on what choose at the start of play), he claims both cards; otherwise, remove the card from the game.

171414.name: Dungeonteller Fantasy RPG
171414.description:
From publisher blurb:

The roleplaying game for everyone.

If you have kids or game-curious adults you want to introduce to RPGs, this is the one, designed to support intergenerational and mixed ability game groups. Rules are presented visually and in casual language. But don't call it rules-light. There are plenty of character advancement and tactical options for advanced players!

This includes the complete free player pack, plus:

detailed descriptions of actions and powers
rules for running the game and managing action scenes
Treasures, scrolls, and gadgets
Free megahex from the Big Hexyland campaign setting
The complete Stormgate City setting, with maps and descriptions
Cutaway view an description of the Tides Inn
Plot, villain, and dungeon generators, with sample dungeon node map
Sample monsters from the forthcoming monster book

171415.name: Dungeonteller Monster Book
171415.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monsters. Lots of monsters.

This is the second big book for the Dungeonteller Fantasy RPG — the roleplaying game for everyone.

Dozens of fantasy monsters with Dungeonteller stats, and full-color vector illustrations.

171416.name: Dungeonteller Iso Battle Counters
171416.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cut and fold monster counters for use on iso perspective battle grids.

Every single monster from the Dungeonteller Monster Book, in full color.

Black matter batter puddings, gnome petranauts, plus all the usual suspects like dragons, ogres, and trolls.

Plus an iso battle grid you can use to create your own floorplans/dungeon mazes.

171417.name: Dungeonteller Pixie Hero
171417.description:
From publisher blurb:

The pixie: A new 8th hero for the Dungeonteller Fantasy RPG -- the RPG for your kids and game-curious grownup friends . The pixie packs a lot of attitude in a little package. Cast pixie dust, tangle a foe in thorns or webs, or call on your meadow friends for help! And wings, to boot. Enjoy!

171418.name: Dungeonteller Witch Hero
171418.description:
From publisher blurb:

The witch: A new 7th hero for Dungeonteller.

171419.description:
My First Bohnanza serves as both an introduction to Bohnanza and as a children's game in its own right, with the goal of the game being the same as its parent: Have the most Talers at the end of play.

As in the original Bohnanza, the game includes multiple types of beans, with each bean having a number on it to indicate how many copies are in the game as well as a "beanometer" at the bottom of the card to show you how many cards of this type you need to harvest in order to collect Talers. My First Bohnanza has simplified beanometers, with four types of beans having only a single exchange value — e.g., five Gemeine (common) beans get you one Taler — and six types of beans having two exchange values. Games with the youngest players (or newcomers to the Bohnanza universe) should use the single beanometer cards with the other cards forming a Taler stack.

To play, each player gets five cards, which they lay in a face-up row, and a beanfield tile that shows spots for two types of beans. On a turn, a player must plant the first (leftmost) card in one of her fields and she can choose to plant a second. Players try to group cards of the same type in the same field, but they can cover beans of different types, if needed. The player then reveals two cards from the deck and either keeps them or trades them (and cards from her hand, if desired) for cards held by other players; all traded cards must be planted. To end her turn, the player draws three cards and adds them to her row.

As soon as a player has the proper number of bean cards in order in one of her fields, she harvests them, placing these cards in the discard pile and collecting a Taler from the stack. If those cards covered beans of another type, she can then start building on those beans again. After going through the deck 1-3 times (depending on the number of players), the game ends and whoever has the most Talers wins.

Once players have played My First Bohnanza a few times, you can swap the single beanometer cards for the double beanometer cards, which now gives players a choice of when to harvest. Subsequently, you can combine the two decks, which introduces the rule about using one of the bean cards to serve as the Taler (which adjusts the quantity of that type of bean in the deck). With additional plays, you can add in the remaining rules of Bohnanza, such as needing to harvest for no Talers when planting, paying for a third beanfield, keeping your cards in hand, and not being able to harvest a field with only one card.
171419.name: My First Bohnanza

171420.name: Bizoo
171420.description:
Bizoo consists 112 cards with different animals.
The aim is to form the couples with the same type of animals to achieve the highest score at the end of the game.

Each player gets 8 cards at the beginning of the game and in his turn player may perform one of the 2 possible actions:
a) form a couple and draw 2 new cards from the deck
or
b) activate an action of any of his cards.
Each animal species have its own ability.

The game ends when a player:

reaches the score of 45 points with couples;
or lays his last card on the table.




The winner is the one that has the most points.

171422.name: ChromaWerks
171422.description:
ChromaWerks was designed for the 18 Card Microgame Contest on BGG.

In ChromaWerks each player uses 9 double sided cards (shuffled) to make a 3x3 grid. Each quadrant of each card is a different color and type of machinery: Red Gears, Yellow Drive Belts, and Blue Pipes. There are also sections of 'broken' machinery with images of damaged components on a black background. Players must take turns completing one of four actions (Flip, Rotate, Slide, or Swap cards) to try to get all four center squares to be completed parts of the machine (solid colors).

171423.description:
A print and play expansion for Jane Austen's Matchmaker offered originally on Jane Austen's birthday December 16, 2014.

Expansion consists of a single card featuring Jane Austen. If a player manages to marry the "correct" gentleman and lady, they can take the Jane Austin Card and add their old maid score to their final score. (A cheat sheet is provided for those who don't know who ended with who.)
171423.name: Put Jane in the Game

171424.description:
Kakerlakak, a portable version of the identically named Kakerlakak, puts a cockroach in the kitchen once again, but this time you get to control the cockroach and try to move him to tasty treats while hoping that the cook stays out of sight.

Each player has a "treat stick" that shows four treats that she must claim in order by moving the cockroach onto the appropriate space on the 6x6 game board. The trick, though, is that items of cutlery lie all over the floor, blocking your way to the treats along with the shelving units that stand in the middle of the floor. As in the original Kakerlakak, the cutlery items have a pivot in their center, and players can turn the cutlery during the game to open and close paths.

On a player's turn, she rolls the cutlery die, then moves the cockroach 2-3 spaces based on the number of pips showing, turning an indicated piece of cutlery before, during or after the move. She then rolls and moves again. Starting after her second move, an opponent rolls the cook die after each movement, and if the cook shows up, that player's turn is over and the dice pass left to the next players. Alternatively, if a player reaches her goal, her turn ends.

The first player to reach all four of her food goals, then reach the hole in the kitchen floor wins.

Kakerlakak includes action rules that speed up gameplay. The cockroach and cook players both roll simultaneously, with the cockroach player moving as quickly as possible because as soon as the fifth cook face is rolled, the turn is over. The winning condition remains the same.
171424.name: Kakerlakak

171425.name: Grav Strike Cruiser
171425.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a Grav Strike Cruiser, another ultra heavy vehicle.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

171426.description:
Printed on a postcard-sized, er, postcard this promo station card was given away free with Lookout Games's magazine Neues von Ausguck (Winter, 2014); it may also be available with purchases from their online store (while stocks last!).

Place a track card and this station between Llanberis and the Pub.
When you excavate, you can choose this track card or the track going up the mountain. The game does NOT excavate, or Build, towards/on the Hotel.

Whenever you build in Pen-Y-Gwrd, move your Surveyor along one Station.

From Wikipedia:
The Pen-y-Gwryd Hotel was originally a simple farmhouse dating from 1811 and would, later, become an Inn. The hotel's most notable mountaineering connections are largely due the first successful Everest expedition in 1953 and the Kangchenjunga expedition in 1955, where training and testing of oxygen equipment for those expeditions took place, at Helyg near Capel Curig. On the right at the hotel entrance there is a Tyrolean style Stuberl with the signatures, written on the ceiling, of the team that did the first ascent of Everest in 1953 and of the successful first ascent of Kangchenjunga in 1955, these include Sir Edmund Hillary, Tenzing Norgay, Sir John Hunt, Charles Evans, George Band, Joe Brown, John Angelo Jackson, Wilfred Noyce, Tony Streather, Tom Mackinnon, Norman Hardie, Neil Mather, John Clegg and others including Noel Odell from Mallory's 1924 expedition and Chris Bonington of later successes. There are many photographs and exhibits provided by the original team members in the main bar and guest lounge. In the past each year, now every five years, Pen-y-Gwryd hosts the Everest and Kangchenjunga reunions.
171426.name: Snowdonia: Pen-y-Gwryd Hotel

171427.name: Scram!
171427.description:
SCRAM!'' is an exciting strategy game for the entire family!

In SCRAM! up to 4 players are represented by a color on the game board. Players share from a common pool of tokens - each with their own special ability.

Players take turns placing tokens to create chain-reactions that move their tokens into scoring position and send opponent's tokens scrambling away... or make their token SCRAM! by driving it off the game board!

The player with the highest value tokens on their own color at the end of the game wins!

171428.name: Pixel Boat Rush
171428.description:
A frantic arcade combat boat racing game, full of popular culture parodic references and set in a 2D sidescrolling pixel art environment.

The gameplay mixes a one-touch racing mechanic with 2 weapon/defensive buttons. The progression features an in-depth career mode and RPG-like humoristic conversations with parodic characters!

An easy to learn, hard to master, fun arcade racing game with loads of content!

Gameplay

One-Touch Racing Mechanic:
Touch to accelerate, release to brake. If you release the gaz on a wave, you'll stick to it. If you keep the gaz pressed, you'll jump off the waves. Releasing the gaz while in the air will make you fall faster.

Obstacles and Power-Ups:
If air drag makes staying on water quicker, sometimes it's best to jump. I could be for grabbing a power-up, avoiding an obstacle or a tricky set of waves.

Combat:
The second button is used for weapons, which adds a completely different dimension to the game. There's pistols, shotguns, machine guns, rockets, lasers, mines, grenades launcher, rail guns, beam guns, boomerangs, stun guns, burst guns, blasters, torpedoes and so on. The game becomes tactical as you save your ammo for the right moment, retreat to a more secure position and avoid being literally obliterated to pieces or let opponents tearing themselves apart before acting.

After the second half of the game, a third button is introduced for a secondary weapon or an active system which can stun, boost, jump, repair or shield you.

The progression of the game has similarities with classic simulation racing games where you progress through licenses tests and various racing events spread across 4 racing categories. There's about 50 different boats, each having its own equipments configuration and behaviour, characterized by top speed, acceleration, downforce, braking and armor. Acquired boats can be upgraded.

Source: The Developer Website.

171429.description:
Alas, the corruption that dwells within us all. Oh, what scandal, what deception! Oh, what cruel manipulation of these two houses! Shall we pity them and grant them leave while these matters are sorted? Nay, the iron is indeed hot and we must strike with all intention. Fellow citizens of Verona, I plead for your joint purpose as we bring the dynasty to level. With power in excess, take what you will, and may the best of us rise to our place.

Council of Verona: Corruption is an expansion for Council of Verona that adds 21 Corruption Cards into the game. Corruption Cards may add new influence spots, be played face-up for an ongoing or instant ability or played face-down for an end-game ability or as a bluff.

Corruption Cards are dealt after the Character Card Draft and played either face-down or face-up on any Character Card on The Council or in Exile, adding an exciting additional layer of bluffing into the game. Each player will be dealt four Corruption Cards of which they will choose two to keep.
171429.name: Council of Verona: Corruption

171430.name: Do Not Forsake Me (Oh My Darling)
171430.description:
Crewed by a group of misfits under your command, the Do Not Forsake Me Oh My Darling is a bounty hunter ship of the Rim Quadrants, sailing the edges of space in search of the dread pirates, criminals and charlatan messiahs who prey on the innocent. Bring them to justice and collect the Bounty Megacredits. Earn 30 Megacredits and you can retire from the wandering life among the stars. Lose your crew and be doomed to haunt the spaceways for all time.

This is a solo game of high adventure in space using only 18 cards and no other components. Rules are included within the 18 card format.

Each turn is broken down into the following phases:

1. Movement
a. Station Re-Equip
b. Repairs in Space

2. Events
a. NavComm
b. Bounty
1. Evade
2. Engage in Combat

3. Combat

The player moves around a randomly generated map of cards and has 4 Ship Systems (Crew, NavComm, Wave Motion Cannon and Fusioncasting Engines) they must balance the use of during the phases of the game.

The game also features a set of Bounty cards which are double-sided and generate all random dice rolls as well as act as an AI in the game, balancing the strength of the bounties again the player's current stats.

171431.name: The Maiden in the Forest
171431.description:
Long ago a maiden mage was trapped in an enchanted forest ring. Through her cunning, and with the help of four magic objects, she attempts to escape her fate.

This is an 18 card solitaire game using only cards, no other components needed. The rules are contained within the 18 cards.

The object of the game is to rotate, and then turn over, each of the twelve Tree Cards from their blooming to dormant side. If you are able to do this before the end of the twelve clock cycles of Day and Night you shall win your freedom.

To begin, shuffle the twelve Tree Cards and place them in a ring like a clock face. All cards should have their blooming side revealed and the trunks should point towards the center of the ring. Each card also shows one of four objects. Place the Maiden Card inside the ring at the 12 o’clock position. Set the four Object Cards to one side.

Each Day you will perform two actions:

1. Shuffle the four Object Cards and place them face down in a pile. Draw the top card and view the object shown therein. All Tree Cards with this object may not be touched by the player during this cycle of Day and Night.

2. Gather the remaining three Object Cards to your hand and use their actions to move, that is to ... swap ... the positions of the Tree Cards allowed to be touched, keeping their current orientations. You may use these actions in any order and may use none, one, two or all three of the actions as you choose to.

Each Night you perform two actions:

1. You may now rotate blossoming Tree Cards with matching colors or matching objects that you are allowed to touch this Night. Cards are rotated so that their trunks point outward from the ring. Cards previous rotated can then be turned over so that their dormant side is showing.

Cards must be rotated (either clockwise or counter-clockwise) or turned over to their dormant side in accordance with the three patterns on the other side of this card. You may use each of the patterns only once during this Night but you may use them in any order you choose.

2. Move the Maiden Card one position in the ring clockwise to signal the end of this Day and Night and the beginning of a new turn.

If you are able to turn each of the twelve Tree Cards over to their dormant side before the end of twelve clock cycles of Day and Night you shall win your freedom.

171432.name: The Inner World

videogamehonor.36237: 2013 Indie Prize Best in Show: Advisor's Choice Winner

171432.description:
The Inner World is a classic-style hand-drawn Adventure game for PC & Mac. Solve plenty of challenging puzzles with Robert and Laura in the twisted world of Asposia. Experience an atmospheric and humorous story full of bizarre characters.

Asposia is a mysterious world. Surrounded by the endless soil and against all laws of physics, Asposia is located in an enormous hollow space, which is ventilated solely through three big wind fountains. In this world lives Robert, a naive and cheerful novice of the last wind monestary.

He lives quite an introspective, simple life as court musician in the shadows of his honored master and ideal Conroy. This changes abruptly, when suddenly one foun-tain after another runs dry and the Windgods befall peaceful Asposia. Now just Robert is in the center of unexpected events!

Together with the mysterious thief Laura, best intentions and not the slightest clue Robert hits the road to solve the secret behind the disappearance of the winds. During his adventure he not only meets bizarre Asposians, but also really strange animals. In addition, Robert hast to solve tricky puzzles, which only could exist in Asposia. Is the young adventurer able to save his world? What are Laura's secrets? And why Robert has such a strange nose?

Source: The Developer Website.

171433.name: GREG - A Mathematical Puzzle Game
171433.description:
GREG is a mathematical puzzle game for iPhone that will enhance your mental flexibility.

The goal of GREG is to sum the numbers written on the tokens in the grid to reach a given number as quickly as possible.
Every time the game timer reach the end all the tokens become hotter until they become black and burn. The game ends when a single token burns.
To cool down the tokens you must use them for a correct sum.

GREG features an unique algorithm that increases the game difficulty as the user reaches higher levels.

GREG has been developed on a solid concept of gamification.
Every time you play you earn gold which is used to purchase special items to help the user in the game.
It also features different types of leaderboards, exciting achievements and an innovative multiplayer mode via Bluetooth LE.

Source: The Developer Website.

171434.name: Pirates Enjoy Math (Don't Say Arrrrrrithmetic)
171434.description:
Pirates Enjoy Math (Don't Say Arrrrrrithmetic) is a micro card game for 2-4 players in which players use math and the Order of Operations to try to become the pirate with the most Loot.

The game consists of two rounds per hand and as many hands as players would like (recommended play is first to 29 points). The first round is a card drafting phase where players try to build a Crew that will help them get the Loot. The second round is where players use their Crew to create a mathematical formula that will get them closest to the Loot Value. The winner gains the Loot, plus each player has a chance to earn Bonus Loot based on the cards they play.

171435.name: Lub vs Dub
171435.description:
User summary
Lub vs Dub is an endless runner game where you play as a cube running along, jumping obstacles and collecting power-ups.

As well as single player mode, there is a two player competitive mode (on the same device).

The game won the British Academy (Bafta) Scotland award in the category 'new talent' in 2014.

171436.name: To Reign Supreme
171436.description:
To Reign Supreme is a 2 player area control war game that uses 18 cards. Each player battles to conquer 6 contested Territories, using the abilities of the territories to build their military and increase their wealth. Battles are conducted via a card based mechanic that limits chance and increases decision based strategy.

Each player has 5 Military Strategy cards and can choose 3 to use throughout the game. Each player starts with the same 5 Military Strategy cards, differing only in card color, and must choose the three that best match their intended strategy. The other two cards and the 2 Rules cards are used to track Wealth, Military, and Battle specific stats for their country.

171437.name: Sonic 3D Blast 5
171437.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Sonic Adventure.




User Summary

Sonic 3D Blast 5 has music that is notorious for its poor quality.Sonic's controls work the same as the Mega Drive games, except poorly programmed and sluggish in comparison. There are numerous enemies ripped from Sonic the Hedgehog 1 & 3 although they're reduced to moving back and forth in this game.

Sonic Adventure 7 is a hack of a pirated game called Sonic 3D Blast 5 and originates from China. The game adds color, alters some of the graphics and changes the order of the levels. What used to be Sonic 3D Blast's intro was replaced with a Sonic & Knuckles' intro and the title screen is a very poor digitisation of Sonic Adventure's boxart. Strangely, the game includes a manual which is mostly a poorly done edit of Sonic Blast's manual, with most references to Knuckles being replaced with the Sonic Adventure 7 logo.

Sonic Adventure 8 has the intro music from S3DB5 again, with the second and fourth level being the first in this.

Pokémon Jade re-uses Sonic Adventure 7 colors are a bit more detailed than Sonic Adventure 7, the music is rearranged, and you control a Pikachu sprite. The game crashes when you complete the first level due to a programming error making it impossible to complete the game.

171438.name: Leo's Fortune

videogamehonor.35066: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

171438.description:
Leo’s Fortune, a beautiful platform adventure game. Hunt down the cunning and mysterious thief that stole your gold. Carefully handcrafted levels bring the story of Leo to life in this epic platform adventure game for iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch.

Embark on an incredible voyage:
Travel through lush environments from mossy forests and arid deserts, to pirate cities and snowy mountains.

24 handcrafted levels:
Survive dangerous traps and solve physics-based puzzles through 24 handcrafted levels of treacherous adventure.

Don’t lose sight of Leo’s goal:
Follow the trail of gold and uncover the truth behind Leo’s stolen fortune.

Source: The Game Website.
[hr]
Leo's Fortune is a popular and highly rated Swedish video game for iOS and Android and Amazon App Store developed by 1337 & Senri LLC. The titular character is a mustachioed 'fluff ball' roly-poly with an thick Eastern European accent. His goal is to recover stolen treasure in the form of gold coins. The player guides Leopold through 20 levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Leo's Fortune", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

171439.name: Pokémon Frigo Returns
171439.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Ruby and Sapphire.




User Summary

Pokémon Frigo Returns is a hack of Pokemon Ruby and features the character from the gamecube Pokemon game called Gale of Darkness on the box art.

171440.name: Pokémon Lugia's Ocean
171440.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Red and Blue.




User Summary

Pokémon Lugias Ocean is a hack of pokemon red originating from Thialand. It has lugia on the cover.

171441.name: Pokemon Blue Sea
171441.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Red and Blue.




User Summary

is a hack of pokemon red. It has blastoise on the cover.

171442.name: Pokemon Liquid Ocean
171442.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pokémon Red and Blue.




User Summary

Pokemon Liquid Ocean is a hack of fire red and has a new region called Soala, storyline,characters, and small side quests.

171443.name: My Big Break
171443.description:
My Big Break is a board game about auditioning in musical theatre. Components of the game are pawns, dice, money, credits, bitter cards, closing cards, and the board pieces. The general idea is that players go on gigs and accumulate a resume in the form of credits so that they eventually are qualified and ready to audition for their 'Big Break'. Booking this gig wins the game.
Player take turns. Each turn has four phases. The first is an income phase, where players earn credits and/or money (except when in NYC, where they have to pay to live there). The second phase is an audition phase where they roll dice to see if they are cast in a gig. The third phase is a movement phase. The last phase the players either can play a 'bitter card' or they 'take class'. Playing a bitter card generally has a detrimental effect on another player. Taking class involves exchanging money and other resources to gain special advanced credits.

Bitter cards are generally earned by failing to book auditions. Closing cards are earned by completing professional gigs. Specialty Credits are required to audition for more advanced gigs, such as Cruise Line and Bus 'N Truck. A player must possess all three specialty credits (acting, vocal, and dance) and must have 15 total credits or more to audition for their 'Big Break'. If a player fails this audition, he/she loses an advanced credit, a generic credit, and gains two bitter cards. Play continues until somebody books their 'Big Break'.

A future expansion of My Big Break is planned which will contain the option to work for a Theme Park and a Dinner Theatre. Players will also be able to wait tables in NYC and take an agent there.

171444.name: Imperiallines (Issue 7 - 2015)
171444.description:
Nobles

From the credits:

Imperiallines is Far Future Enterprises' trademark for its science fiction game magazine devoted to Traveller5.

171445.name: Urusei Yatsura - Lum's Wedding Bell
171445.description:
User summary

A stage-styled platform game based on the comic book Urusei Yatsura by Rumiko Takahashi. The player controls Lum running around on various stages, jumping over holes in the floor and climbing ladders in order to reach the top where she can be rescued by an alien ship. The game starts at Kindergarten level, and for each level, Lum gets slightly older, advancing towards current time.

Translated from the box back:
A big earthquake has struck Tomobiki high! The school's on fire!
The earthquake has caused time glitches, and I'm being warped from the past into the future.
And this isn't the school, but my old kindergarten!
Avoid the fire and jump over the crushed floor!! I must reach the UFO at the top!.
I must warp back to the time where my darling is, and marry him in the future!

Individual credits:
Rumiko Takahashi: Original work

171446.name: Outlanders
171446.description:
User summary:

A role-playing game based on the comic book Outlanders by Johji Manabe.

The plaeyr controls Tetsuya, who has been caught by the emperor, and he needs to find and resque Kahm, Battia and the others.

The game is an action-type RPG, where all battles are done via maneuvering on the screen and swining your sword. The player need to constantly find food, or Tetuya's hit points will decrease as he walks.
